instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Arriving with Laksmana at the lake filled with lotuses, lilies and fishes, Rama, his senses oppressed, burst into tears.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He was glad to see it but sad at the thought of Sita. His passion stirred, his senses shaken, he said this to Saumitri:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri Pampa looks beautiful with its water clear as vaidurya, its lilies and lotuses in full bloom and its trees in all their variety.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri look at the pleasant forest around Pampa where trees stand splendid like mountainpeaks.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Already saddened due to the abduction of Sita and plight of Bharata, I am tormented by Spring.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Though stricken with grief, I feel so delighted to see the auspicious Pampa with its wonderful forest and cool water scattered with flowers.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Abounding in lotuses, birds and beasts and vicious serpents moving about, it looks splendid indeed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The bluishyellow grass, dotted with different kinds of flowers fallen from the trees shines like a carpet spread.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Entwined with flowering creepers the treetops are covered all over with rich loads of flowers.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri it is the season of spring. The trees are laden with fruits and fragrant flowers. Ecstatic blows the gentle freeze.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look at the flowering trees sending showers of flowers like water dropping from the clouds, O Saumitri
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Various forest trees shaken by the force of the wind scatter flowers on the beautiful rocky surface of earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Saumitri! look, the breeze appears to be playing with the flowers; that are fallen and that are still on the trees.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: "As the wind shakes the flowers off the branches of various trees the bees bumble in tune with the (whistling) wind.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: "As if the trees are dancing to the music of the cuckoos and to the sound of the wind coming out of the mountain-caves.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: "Shaken by the strong wind all over, the tops of trees look as if they are knitted together.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The gentle touch of the breeze that blows, cool like sandalwood, full of pure fragrance, takes away the fatigue of the body.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As if the trees are singing, swayed by the wind, while the bees in the forest, fragrant with honey, hum in tune.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The huge trees in the scenic mountainranges look delightful with their blossoms touching the peaks.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With the tops of trees covered with flowers, the black bees hovering (humming) over them, the trees, shaken by the restless wind look like singers. (The trees with the top decked with flowers, the bees like black hair on the head swaying in the wind look like dancing and singing)
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'See these Karnikaras in full bloom all over, looking like people clad in yellow silk adorned with golden ornaments.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri this spring season resonating with the sounds of several kinds of birds, kindles my anguish as I am separated from Sita.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Kandarpa (Cupid) torments me while I am already griefstricken. The Cuckoo with his challenging cheerfulness mocks me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Lakshmana, while I am already lovestricken, the swamphen (gallinule, a marshbird) troubles me with its joyous cackles in the beautiful foreststream.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'While in the hermitage in the past, my beloved was very glad to hear such sounds, invite me to join her and rejoice again.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'See, the different kinds of birds flying towards trees, shrubs and vines making wonderful sounds all over.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lakshmana the female birds praised by their flocks, are united with their male partners. Enjoying the sweet sounds of large black bees, they are singing melodiously.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: These trees seem to enkindle my passion through all sorts of sounds like the loud cackle of swamphens and the sweet warble of the male cuckoos.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The fire of spring with clusters of Asoka flowers as its charcoal, its coppercoloured tender leaves as flames, the buzz of bees as its crackle will, as if, consume me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri my life is meaningless if I cannot see my beloved Sita with her delicate eyelashes, beautiful locks of hair and her sweet voice.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O sinless one, the spring season is dear to my beloved Sita when the outskirts of the forest are filled with voices of the cockoo.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The fire of grief ignited by Kandarpa (the god of love), enhanced by the effects of spring will certainly consume me soon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Unable to see my beloved wife, the very sight of these lovely trees intensifies my love for her who shines resplendent in me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When in place of Vaidehi I see spring (with its cool breeze) that used to take away the sweat generated by sensual enjoyment, my sorrow is intensified.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri the cruel breeze of the spring forest torments me as I am now immersed in grief in the absence of my fawneyed beloved.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Delightful are the peacocks dancing here and there, their feathers looking like crystal windows flung open by the wind.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The peacocks intoxicated with passion for the peahens surround them intensifying my longing (for Vaidehi).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look at the lovelorn peahen, excited by love, dancing on the moutain slope, O Lakshmana  Engrossed in love, she dances for wooing the peacock.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Overwhelmed with love, the enchanted peacock, spreading his wings is running after her, making sounds, as though mocking her.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The peacock's beloved, for sure, has not been abducted by the demon. Therefore, he is dancing in delight in the forest in the company of his beloved.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It is extremely unbearable for me to stay in the forest during this season of flowers (Spring). Look at the passion even among beasts and birds, O Lakshmana And craving for love, the peahen sports near her mate.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Had the largeeyed Janaki not been stolen, she would have also paid advances to me in this manner with all her love and excitement.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The trees look enchanting with flowers in full bloom, with bees hovering over them. But the flowers fruitlessly drop down on the ground.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If spring reigns wherever my beloved Sita is, she must have been overwhelmed with similar sad feelings like me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Spring must not have touched the place where she is now staying. Otherwise how could my Sita with eyes like blue lotus live without me?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Or, if there is spring where my beloved lives, what can that lady of beautiful hips do, threatened by enemies.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Eager to speak with her gentle voice, my young beloved, blessed with eyes like lotus petals, will certainly give up her life, unable to enjoy the spring.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'My mind makes me feel certain that Sita with her chastity might not be able to live separated from me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Sita has her love truly fixed in me. My love for her is equally steadfast.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This cool breeze that carries the fragrance of flowers, that is gentle in its touch feels like fire when I think about my beautiful beloved.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The pleasant touch of the wind, which made me happy in the company of Sita intensifies my grief now in her absence.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The crow that cried unhappily flying in the sky as if to foretell my separation from Sita, is now on the tree, singing joyfully (suggesting my possible union with Sita).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The same crow attendant on Vaidehi there will take me to my largeeyed beloved.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Losten, O Lakshmana to the sweet warblings of the birds on the blossoming treetops of the forest. My love for her (Sita) enhances with their sweet voices.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This honeybee is eager to approach the bunch of tilaka flowers in bloom scattered by the wind like a lover advancing towards his passionate beloved.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This asoka tree increases (by nature) the sorrow of lovers. Perhaps it make its presence felt in order to intimidate me with the clusters of its flowers scattered by the wind.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lakshmana these mangotrees full of blossoms appear like sexited men who have applied fragrant unguents to their bodies.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri O' tiger among men look at the kinnaras wandering here and there, in the wonderful forest around the Pampa lake.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lakshmana look at these lotuses with fine fragrance all over the water glowing like the rising Sun.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This Pampa with its water clear and fragrant with red and blue lotuses is filled with swans and geese.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Lake Pampa shines with lotuses with bees on their filaments like the rising sun.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Frequented by the Chakravakas and surrounded by the wonderful forest with thirsty elephants and deer this Pampa looks beautiful.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lakshmana look at the lotuses in clear water dashing against one another due to waves caused by the force of the wind.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Unable to see my beloved with eyes large like totus petals and an ardent lover of lotuses, I have no desire to live.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Oh how adversly disposed is the god of love He makes me remember that auspicious lady with a pleasing voice when she is lost and difficult to reach.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If the spring that has set in, with the trees in bloom does not kill me, I have once again to endure the agony of love.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Whatever was endearing to me earlier in the company of Sita, has turned out to be disenchanting without her.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Seeing the delicate petals around the lotus buds that look like beautiful eyelids of Sita, my eyes crave for them O Lakshmana
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The bleeze that blows through the trees carrying the fragrance of the filaments of lotuses feels pleasant like Sita's breath.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look at the very spectacular karnikara tree with its blossmed branches on the mountain slope towards the southern side of Pampa, O Saumitri
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This king of mountains is rich with plenty of minerals and, therefore, generates multicoloured dust particles splattered by the speed of the wind.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri With leafless kimsuka trees in full bloom all over the mountain ranges they appear beautiful like blazing mountains.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Very closely grown on the banks of Pampa, stand malati, mallika and karavira trees with their clusters of fragrant blossoms.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Fully blossmed ketaka, sinduvara, madhavi and kunda bushes in spring scatter their fragrance everywhere.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Chiribilva, madhuka, vanjula, bakula, champaka, tilaka and naga varana and kharjura trees are in full bloom.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Lotuses and blue asokas are also in bloom. Lodhra trees on the mountainslopes look golden like the lion's mane.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There are trees like ankola, kuranta, churnaka, paribhadraka, mango, patali, kovidara, muchukunda, arjuna, ketaka, uddalaka, shirisha, shimshupa and shava, all in full bloom on the mountain peaks.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There are trees like ankola, kuranta, churnaka, paribhadraka, mango, patali, kovidara, muchukunda, arjuna, ketaka, uddalaka, shirisha, shimshupa and shava, all in full bloom on the mountain peaks.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri look at the beauty of these numerous flowering trees on the banks of Pampa, entwining creepers with blooming tops.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri look at the beauty of these numerous flowering trees on the banks of Pampa, entwining creepers with blooming tops.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'While the branches of trees swayed by the wind draw close, the creepers follow the trees like lovely women in a drunken state.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The wind blows from tree to tree, mountain to mountain, and forest to forest as though content to enjoy all the fragrance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Some trees stood fragrant with profuse flowers and some with buds shining blue.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Fascinated by the flowers, the honeybees cling to one or the other, humming, 'this is soft, this is sweet, and this is fullyblossomed.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The bees greedy for honey move among the trees on the banks of Pampa. Resting for a while, at one place they fly soon to another.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'With countless flowers fallen on their own from trees and scattered like a bed of flowers on stone the ground is rendered comfortable enough to relax on.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri varieties of colourful flowers, some red and some yellow, are spread out on the mountain slopes.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Winter has ended and the season of flowers has set in, O Saumitri The trees are full of flowers as if competing with one another.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The trees, crowned with flowers filled with humming bees, look splendid. It appears they are calling one another, O Lakshmana
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This duck, entering into auspicious water, sports with its beloved and incites my love.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Only Ganga, like Pampa, has such captivating charm. Its beauty and virtues are famous in the world.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lakshmna, the best of the Raghu race, if only that chaste Sita appears, we will stay here. I will not wish for the position of Indra or for Ayodhya.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If I can sport with Sita in this beautiful green grassy land, I will not have any worry, I would not desire for any other pleasure.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'These trees with their beautiful leaves and varieties of flowers bring me agony as I live in this forest separated from my beloved.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri look at this lake of cool water filled with, lotuses, chakravakas flying about and ducks floating.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pampa, filled with swimming, kraunchas and frequented by big animals looks splendid. The joyous warbling of a variety of birds is highly exciting. They kindle my passion for my young, Moonfaced, lotus eyed beloved.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pampa, filled with swimming, kraunchas and frequented by big animals looks splendid. The joyous warbling of a variety of birds is highly exciting. They kindle my passion for my young, Moonfaced, lotus eyed beloved.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Look at the (male) deer happily roaming here and there together with the female deer on the colourful mountain slopes. Separated from the fawneyed Vaidehi, this sight fills my heart with agony.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If I find my dear beloved here on these mountain slopes full of passionate birds how happy will I not feel
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri I can be alive and happy if Sita of slender waist enjoys here with me the sweet breeze of Pampa.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lakshmana blessed are those who enjoy the breeze filled with fragrance of lotuses of the surrounding forests of Pampa. The gentle and auspicious breeze indeed takes away the sorrow of the mind.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'How can Janaka's daughter with eyes like lotus petals, so young and loving, sustain her life? Away from me, she must be feeling quite dejected.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If righteous and truthful Janaka enquires about Sita's wellbeing in the assembly of people, what am I to speak ?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'She followed me, O Lakshmana  as I was deposed from the kingdom and distraught. Now helpless, how can I live without her?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Unable to see her beautiful, face with auspicious eyes like fragrant lotuses, I feel (so) depressed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When can I listen to Sita's sweet, wholesome and virtuous, incomparable words interlaced with her gentle smile, O Lakshmana?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: My young and faithful beloved used to put up a brave face and speak to me in all propriety to cheer me up in the midst of suffering in the forest whenever I felt tormented by passion.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Prince, what can I tell the highminded Kausalya at Ayodhya when she asks the whereabouts of her daughterinlaw'?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You may go to Ayodhya, O Lakshmana, to see our loving brother, Bharata. It is not possible for me to survive without the daughter of Janaka'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus spoke Lakshmana these befitting, unforgettable words to his hissouled brother, Rama wailing like an orphan:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, the foremost of men, control yourself. Be blessed. People who are pure at heart do not feel depressed at heart.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Remembrance of loved ones causes sorrow. Even a wet cotton wick gets burnt by embracing excessive oil. Hence abandon grief.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Even if Ravana escapes into the nether world or into a world still lower, he cannot save himself by any means, O Rama
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Once the whereabouts of that sinful demon are known he will either deliver Sita or die.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Even if Ravana enters into the womb of Diti (mother of demons) along with Sita, I will slay him there if he does not return the daughter of Mithila.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O noble prince be blessed. maintain composure. Without making any effort it is not possible to achieve the objective and recoup loss.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O revered Sire, enterprise is supreme strength. Nothing is difficult in this world for one who is up and doing.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Enterprising men will never be disappointed in their mission. It is possible to get Sita through effort alone.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Bardon grief. Give up emotion. You are a great soul. You are not aware of your great accomplishments. (The temporary sorrow has relegated Rama's nobility to the background. Lakshmana is trying to restore the same)'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus persuaded by Lakshmana, Rama who was hitherto besieged by grief and delusion, could set them aside and regain patience.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: No more disturbed by delusion, Rama of unimaginable valour, crossed the very brilliant Pampa with beautiful plants floating on its surface.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great Rama was overcome with grief while scanning the entire forest with its streams and caves. Engrossed in her thoughts, dejected at heart and inflicted with pain, he set both, accompanied by Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great soul, Lakshmana, striding like a mighty elephant, with a steady mind, followed Rama dutifully, protecting him with his strength.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The swiftfooted, mighty king of monkeys saw those two men of wonderful appearance as they were wandering at Rishyamuka. He neither got scared nor showed signs of nervousness.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great soul, Sugriva, walking slowly like an elephant saw both of them and became despondent, worried and immersed in fear.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having seen the mighty Rama and Lakshmana, all other monkeys got frightened and ran into a sacred and safe hermitage. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे प्रथमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the first sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 1 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing the two great souls, heroic Rama and Lakshmana wielding the best of weapons, Sugriva was alarmed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Agitated at heart, the best of vanaras started in all directions and could not settle down at one spot.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Beholding the two strong heroes, the monkey (Sugriva) was very much frightened. His heart sank.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Righteous Sugriva, became highly agitated, deliberated with all his followers on the pros and cons of the situation.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva, lord of monkeys, extremely agitated at the sight of both Rama and Lakshmana, spoke to his minister:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing these supreme bowmen, Sugriva's counsellers left for the peak of another mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The leaders of the monkey troops  reached Sugriva, the lord of monkeys, in no time  and stood surrounding him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Jumping  from one mountain to another swiftly and shaking the mountain tops, the monkeys reached one spot.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the mighty monkeys jumping on the trees in full bloom shook them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great monkeys went on leaping all over the great (Rishyamuka) mountain,   scaring the deer, wildcats and tigers.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter, all the ministers of Sugriva assembled together on the king of mountains and stood (in front of Sugriva), with folded hands.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Suspecting that Vali might have sent them (Rama and Lakshmana), Hanuman, skilful in communication, said to Sugriva who was trembling in fear:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This is a great mountain range of Malaya and there is no fear for Vali here. Give up this fear.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O chief of monkeys I do not see here any sign of the cruel Vali, of whom you are afraid.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O goodnatured Sugriva you are afraid of your elder brother Vali as he is evilminded and sinful. (But) I do not see any reason for you to be frightened as he is not found anywhere here.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Oh monkey, whoever is lilylivered cannot be steady. It is evident that your very nature as a monkey makes you restless.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard the wise words of Hanuman, Sugriva addressed him with words more auspicious.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Who would not be apprehensive of these two longarmed and largeeyed individuals     comparable to sons of gods wielding arrows, bows and swords.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I support these two excellent men might have been sent by Vali. Kings have many friends and so it may not be appropriate to trust any king.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'One has to identify these men roaming in disguise. These are not trustworthy and could even be our enemies, making us believe them so as to attack us when we are not vigilant.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vali is wise in his actions. Kings employ many strategies to annihilate their enemies. Our gullible individuals should be able to detect them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Hanuman assume an ordinary form and approach them. Try to read them through their gestures, traits, forms and conversations.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O best of monkeys ascertain their purpose by praising them and studying their honest intentions. Gain the confidence of the wielders of bows and if you find them agreeable, enquire the purpose of their entering this forest.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O best of monkeys ascertain their purpose by praising them and studying their honest intentions. Gain the confidence of the wielders of bows and if you find them agreeable, enquire the purpose of their entering this forest.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O best of monkeys find out whether they are noble in their intentions or evil in their design through your conversation with them.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Instructed thus by the king of the monkeys, Hanuman, son of the Windgod, decided to meet both Rama and Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman, the venerable, powerful and not easily conquerable monkey, honoured the words of the great Lord of the monkeys, offered salutations and said 'So be it'. And then proceeded towards the mighty Rama and Lakshmana. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वितीयस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the second sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 2 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Listening to great Sugriva, Hanuman leaped from mount Rishyamuka on to the location of the Raghavas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, with an ingenious mind assumed the guise of a mendicant.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Approaching the Raghavas in all humility, valiant Hanuman offered them reverential salutations and addressed them in gentle and pleasing words.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The valiant son of the Windgod, Hanuman offered those heroes whose power came from their sense of truth due respect and spoke to them in all gentleness:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You both fair in complexion, resemble royal sages or gods. You appear like ascetics and pursue vows in austerity. How come, you are present here, as if to frighten the animals and other creatures roaming this forest?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You both fair in complexion, resemble royal sages or gods. You appear like ascetics and pursue vows in austerity. How come, you are present here, as if to frighten the animals and other creatures roaming this forest?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Gazing at the trees on the bank of Pampa, you both appear in brilliant complexion as if to enhance the beauty of the auspicious river water. Though young, courageous and with handsome shoulders, you seem to sigh in exhaustion. And though you look like ascetics robed in bark,  you seem to terrify these creatures.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Gazing at the trees on the bank of Pampa, you both appear in brilliant complexion as if to enhance the beauty of the auspicious river water. Though young, courageous and with handsome shoulders, you seem to sigh in exhaustion. And though you look like ascetics robed in bark,  you seem to terrify these creatures.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having the gaze  of a lion, both of you are heroic in your stance. As each of you hold a bow resembling the rainbow, you seem to be mighty warriors eager to annihilate the enemies. With the valour of superior bulls and your shoulders resembling elephant's trunks, you look magnificent, handsome and brilliant. (No doubt,) you are the best among the humans.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having the gaze  of a lion, both of you are heroic in your stance. As each of you hold a bow resembling the rainbow, you seem to be mighty warriors eager to annihilate the enemies. With the valour of superior bulls and your shoulders resembling elephant's trunks, you look magnificent, handsome and brilliant. (No doubt,) you are the best among the humans.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are young and radiant like the gods. This king of mountains (Rishyamuka) dazzles with your brilliance. Although you deserve to be sovereigns, how is it that you are here (into the forest)?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Both of you appear alike, with eyes like lotus petals and locks of matted hair. You look like heroes descending from the world of the gods. You look like the Sun and the Moon dropped incidentally on this earth. With shoulders like those of a lion and the majesty of energetic bulls, you broadchested warriors appear like divine beings, though in fact humans.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Both of you appear alike, with eyes like lotus petals and locks of matted hair. You look like heroes descending from the world of the gods. You look like the Sun and the Moon dropped incidentally on this earth. With shoulders like those of a lion and the majesty of energetic bulls, you broadchested warriors appear like divine beings, though in fact humans.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Your long arms and spherelike shoulders appear as strong as iron clubs. Although they deserve to be decked with ornaments, how is it they are unadorned?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'To me, you both deserve to rule the entire earth encompassed by seas and forests and adorned with mountains like Vindhya and Meru.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Smeared with wonderful unguents, (your) bows look  very attractive. And they glow very much like Indra's golden thunderbolt.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: '(Your) quivers also appear beautiful, for they are  fully  filled with sharp and deadly arrows which look like the hissing of dreadful snakes
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: '(Your) long and broad swords appear very huge in size. Being encrusted with pure gold, they  glitter brilliant like snakes in hyberation.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Why are you silent  while I am talking? (I am here to apprise ) about a great and righteous warrior Sugriva, the chief of the troop of monkeys, sadly wandering all over the land here, banished by his brother
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Why are you silent  while I am talking? (I am here to apprise ) about a great and righteous warrior Sugriva, the chief of the troop of monkeys, sadly wandering all over the land here, banished by his brother
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am a monkey called Hanuman. I am here sent by great king Sugriva, the best of monkeys.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The righteous Sugriva wishes to make friendship with both of you. For his wellbeing I came here disguised as a mendicant from  Rishyamuka mountain. I am a monkey, son of the Windgod and minister to Sugriva. I can assume any form at my free will and go anywhere I like'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The righteous Sugriva wishes to make friendship with both of you. For his wellbeing I came here disguised as a mendicant from  Rishyamuka mountain. I am a monkey, son of the Windgod and minister to Sugriva. I can assume any form at my free will and go anywhere I like'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The eloquent Hanuman, having spoken thus to both Rama and Lakshmana, good at speaking, said no more.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard him, the Illustrious Rama cheerfully said to brother Lakshmana standing nearby:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Here is minister to Sugriva, the great chief of monkeys whom I wish to see.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Saumitri, conqueror of enemies this monkey, Sugriva's minister, is skilled in friendly communication. Reply to him in words gentle and sweet.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Unless wellversed in Rigveda, Yajurveda and Samaveda, for sure, it is not possible for anyone to articulate so well.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Surely, he seems to have studied well the whole of grammar, for there is not a single mispronunciation in his entire speech.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: No fault can be found in his face, eyes, forehead, between the eyebrows or any other part of his body (during his expression).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: His sentences are not too elaborate, not ambiguous, not dragging, not fast, raised in the chest or throat, in a medium tone.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'His words are auspicious. They are refined. Neither fast nor slow, his utterances captivate the heart.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'His colourful words flow from all the three sources: the bottom of his bosom, his throat and his head. Whose mind will not adore them even if one happens to be an enemy holding a sword?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O sinless one, how can a king, whoever he be, not accomplish his goal in the past with such an ambassador?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Whoever has such great taskmasters of great qualities as their envoys, can have all their goals accomplished, driven by their diplomatic skills.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus instructed, Saumitri who was equally skilled in speach replied to Sugriva's minister, son of the Windgod
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O learned Hanuman having heard about the virtues of  great Sugriva, lord of the monkeys, we eagerly look forward to meeting him
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O virtuous Hanuman we will do whatever you are saying, for it is the message of Sugriva.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pleased with Lakshmana's words spoken in a skilful manner, Hanuman, the monkey son of the Windgod, resolved to make friendship with them. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे तृतीयस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the third sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 3 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After listening to the sweet words of Lakshmana, Hanuman, having done what he had to do felt happy and thought of Sugriva.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great Sugriva, thinks Hanuman, who had done his duty is likely to acquire his kingdom, because great Rama who would help in the work of Sugriva has also come.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman, the best of the monkeys, learned in conversation, felt extremely happy and enquired from Rama:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Why have you come with your brother to this dreadful, inaccessible forest surrounding Pampa, full of different varieties of serpents and wild animals?'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having listened to Hanuman, and urged by Rama, Lakshmana told him about the great Rama, son of Dasaratha.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'He never hated any one nor did any one ever hate him. To all his subjects, he was like another father, the Creator Brahma. And he was generous in giving gifts while performing yajnas (rituals with fire) like Agnistoma.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Here is his eldest son, popularly known as Rama. He is the protector of all beings and never failed his father's instructions.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This glorious Rama was followed by his wife, Sita, like the rays of the effulgent Sun follow him to the end of the day.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am his younger brother, called Lakshmana. I have accepted the service of this learned, virtuous and grateful man.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This man who should have lived in comfort and in reverence, one who was worthy of all the wellwishers lost his wealth and was banished into the forest. He is now deprived of his wife kidnapped by an unknown demon who could assume any form at will.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This man who should have lived in comfort and in reverence, one who was worthy of all the wellwishers lost his wealth and was banished into the forest. He is now deprived of his wife kidnapped by an unknown demon who could assume any form at will.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Diti's son called Danu who had been cursed to live the life of a demon had said that Sugriva, the best among monkeys, would be able to locate her.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'That Valiant Sugriva can spot the demon who has abducted your wife', said Danu and disappeared happily into heaven shining in brilliance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I have given a factual account of everything, since you asked me. Now Rama and I have arrived seeking Sugriva's shelter.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having earned supreme fame through his munificence in the past, this lord of the world now craves Sugriva's indulgence.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'One whose father was once a protector of dharma, a refuge to all now seeks Sugriva's shelter.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This righteous Rama who used to lend in the past protection to the whole world and, indeed, a refuge to all, venerable sir, now seeks Sugriva's shelter.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This Rama for whose grace the subjects were ever bobolden to him now seeks the favour of the Chief of monkeys.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Famous in all the three worlds, this Rama, who was the firshborn of Dasaratha, endowed with all virtues and ever respected by all the kings of this earth, now seeks shelter of Sugriva, Chief of monkeys.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Famous in all the three worlds, this Rama, who was the firshborn of Dasaratha, endowed with all virtues and ever respected by all the kings of this earth, now seeks shelter of Sugriva, Chief of monkeys.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Sugriva, lord of monkeys, ought to help Rama who tormented by, and overwhelmed with, grief seeks his favour.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To Saumitri who was speaking thus in a piteous tone, his eyes filled with tears the eloquent Hanuman replied:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It is a matter of great fortune that you who have intelligence, control over your senses and conquered anger have come to see the lord of monkeys who needs instead, to approach you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: '(In fact) seriously offended by his brother Vali who treated him like his enemy and expelled him from the kingdom. He is now abandoned in the forest, his wife hijacked.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Sugriva, son of the Sungod, along with us will extend all help to you, in your search for Sita.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman, having spoken with sweet, gentle words said to the Raghavas, 'We will now go to Sugriva'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having offered reverential salutations to Hanuman as per tradition, righteous Lakshmana now spoke to Rama:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Raghava this monkey, son of the Windgod appears pleased as evident from his words. As he is a man of action, take your work as accomplished now.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It is evident from his words  and from his cheerful face that Hanuman is pleased. (I know that) this heroic son of the Windgod will never tell a lie'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, endowed with great wisdom carried both the Raghava warriors to the king of monkeys.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman, who was an elephant among monkeys, gave up the guise of a mendicant, and assuming the form of the monkeys, lifted both the heroes  on to his back and proceeded.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The son of the Windgod, the most valiant, the supremely heroic monkey and the one welladmired, having performed his task, felt immensely happy.And with an auspicious feeling, departed for the great mountain (Rishyamuka) along with Rama and Lakshmana. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किंधाकाण्डे चतुर्थस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fourth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 4 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Leaving Rishyamuka, Hanuman reached the Malaya mountain. Seeing the chief of monkeys there, he announced the arrival of  the heroic Raghavas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This Rama of greatwisdom and valour, endowed with the power of truth has arrived here along with his brother Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Born in the Ikshvaku race Rama Dasaratha's son, distinguished for his righteousness is here to carry out the orders of his father.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'While the great Rama armed with selfrestraint was living in the forest, his wife was abducted by Ravana. So he has come to you seeing refuge.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This Rama, son of a king who had gratified the firegod through many yajnas like  Rajasuya and Aswamedha, gifted hundreds of thousands of cows and ruled this earth with truth and austerity, has come seeking help for a woman.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This Rama, son of a king who had gratified the firegod through many yajnas like  Rajasuya and Aswamedha, gifted hundreds of thousands of cows and ruled this earth with truth and austerity, has come seeking help for a woman.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Both the brothers, Rama and Lakshmana seek friendship with you. As both of them are worthiest of worship, welcome them with due reverence.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman's words took away Sugriva's great fear for Rama and filled him with cheer. This bull among monkeys gave up his natural appearance and and assuming an attractive human form spoke to Rama lovingly:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman's words took away Sugriva's great fear for Rama and filled him with cheer. This bull among monkeys gave up his natural appearance and and assuming an attractive human form spoke to Rama lovingly:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are a great hero, affectionate to all and wellversed in all dharmas. The son of the Windgod has, in fact, apprised me  of your virtues
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lord that you are eager to have friendship with me, who is a monkey is a great honour and is extremely beneficial to me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If you are desirous of my friendship, here is my arm (palm) stretched out to you. With due regard, establish our bond firmly, holding my palm in yours.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama became very happy to hear Sugriva's warm words and pressed his hand with his. Delighted, he went close  to Sugriva and hugged him tightly and  affectionately.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then, Hanuman vanquisher of enemies, gave up his guise of a mendicant, assumed his natural form and generated fire by rubbing two pieces of wood. Wellpleased at heart, he made an offering of flowers to the flaming fire and placed it between them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then, Hanuman vanquisher of enemies, gave up his guise of a mendicant, assumed his natural form and generated fire by rubbing two pieces of wood. Wellpleased at heart, he made an offering of flowers to the flaming fire and placed it between them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They both circumambulated the blazing fire and solemnized their friendship.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and the monkey contented at heart, yet not fully content, continued looking at each other.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are a dear friend to me. Your sorrow is my sorrow, your pleasure is my  pleasure. We are one and the same' said Sugriva to Rama, his heart overflowing with happiness.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Sugriva cut the branch of a sala tree with luxuriant leaves and flowers, spread it on the ground and sat down along with Raghava.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Hanuman, the bull among monkeys, felt very happy, cut the branch of a sandalwood tree full of flowers and gave it to Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Sugriva, eyes sparkling with joy, replied to Rama in a sweet, gentle voice.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, I have been insulted deeply and my wife hijacked. Stricken with fear I have taken refuge in this inaccessible forest.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama humiliated by my brother Vali, I have developed enmity with him. Terribly distraught and disturbed I live in this forest in great fear.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O reverend Kakutstha, I feel helpless with fear from Vali. Save me. You should release me free from fear.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The righteous and glorious Rama to whom dharma is very dear said to Sugriva with a gentle smile on his face, when he was entreated thus:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O great monkey I know friendship is the fruit of a beneficial deed. I will kill that Vali who has usurped your wife.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'These arrows covered with kanka feathers, sharp and straight at the tip, comparable to great Indra's thunderbolt are (burning bright) like the sun. Looking like angry serpents, they will unfailingly strike at the miscreant Vali soon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'These arrows covered with kanka feathers, sharp and straight at the tip, comparable to great Indra's thunderbolt are (burning bright) like the sun. Looking like angry serpents, they will unfailingly strike at the miscreant Vali soon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'With these sharp, serpentlike arrows Vali will be killed. He will fall down on the ground like a mountain shattered.You will see it now'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva, very much pleased with the words of Rama, spoke highly (of him).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, by your grace I will get my wife and kingdom back. O king accomplish this so that I can destroy my, elder brother, my enemy, O lion among men
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.
