instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Sugriva was making a friendly alliance with Rama, Sita's left eye, like lotus, Vali's left eye glittering like gold and Ravana's left eye blazing (like fire) twitched at the same time for a moment (Twitching of left eye is considered auspicious to a woman and ominous to a man). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fifth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 5 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva was pleased to say to Rama, delight of the Raghu race once again, 'O Rama, Hanuman, jewel among Ministers, has told me the cause of your coming to this desolate forest. While you were residing in the forest, a demon who was looking for an opportunity carried off your wife, the princess from Mithila, daughter of Janaka, finding her alone. While she was crying (piteously) he killed Jatayu. (the vulture who pretested).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva was pleased to say to Rama, delight of the Raghu race once again, 'O Rama, Hanuman, jewel among Ministers, has told me the cause of your coming to this desolate forest. While you were residing in the forest, a demon who was looking for an opportunity carried off your wife, the princess from Mithila, daughter of Janaka, finding her alone. While she was crying (piteously) he killed Jatayu. (the vulture who pretested).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva was pleased to say to Rama, delight of the Raghu race once again, 'O Rama, Hanuman, jewel among Ministers, has told me the cause of your coming to this desolate forest. While you were residing in the forest, a demon who was looking for an opportunity carried off your wife, the princess from Mithila, daughter of Janaka, finding her alone. While she was crying (piteously) he killed Jatayu. (the vulture who pretested).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva was pleased to say to Rama, delight of the Raghu race once again, 'O Rama, Hanuman, jewel among Ministers, has told me the cause of your coming to this desolate forest. While you were residing in the forest, a demon who was looking for an opportunity carried off your wife, the princess from Mithila, daughter of Janaka, finding her alone. While she was crying (piteously) he killed Jatayu. (the vulture who pretested).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Very soon you will be relieved of the grief caused by the separation from your wife. Just as Visnu retrieved the Vedas (carried away by the demons, Madhu and Kaitabha) I will deliver her to you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O subduer of enemies I will restore her to you even if she is kept in the bowels of the earth or in the vaults of heaven.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O longarmed Rama, take these words of mine as true. Your consort cannot be absorbed with impunity even by the denizens of heaven including Indra or the ogres on earth any more than food cooked with poison.Give up grief.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O longarmed Rama, take these words of mine as true. Your consort cannot be absorbed with impunity even by the denizens of heaven including Indra or the ogres on earth any more than food cooked with poison.Give up grief.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Yes, I remember. I had observed a lady being carried away by a wicked demon. She was crying loudly 'Oh, Rama Oh Rama Oh Lakshmana' in a husky voice. It was Maithili. She was wriggling on the lap of Ravana like a female serpent.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Yes, I remember. I had observed a lady being carried away by a wicked demon. She was crying loudly 'Oh, Rama Oh Rama Oh Lakshmana' in a husky voice. It was Maithili. She was wriggling on the lap of Ravana like a female serpent.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Seeing me as the fifth member seated on a mountain  she dropped down the auspicious ornaments (bundled) in her veil
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Rama, we have kept  them safely. I will fetch them so that you should be able to identify them.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama then said to Sugriva, one who used pleasing words, 'O my friend why delay? Get them here immediately'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing this, Sugriva at once entered into the deep cave of the mountain (to get the ornaments and veil) in order to please Rama.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: That monkey brought out the veil and auspicios ornaments, showed them to Rama and said, 'Please, see.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Holding the raiment  as well as the ornaments,  Rama's  eyes were filled with tears.He appeared like the Moon covered with dews.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On account of his deep attachment for Sita, he shed profuse tears. Unable to maintain his natural composure, he sank down to the ground, saying 'O my darling Sita' and cried inconsolably
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pressing the excellent ornaments to his bosom again and again Rama hissed like a cobra provoked in its anthill.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama began to wail piteously while tears streamed down his eyes incessantly. He looked at Saumitri standing by his side and said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lakshmana, behold the veil and the ornaments dropped on the ground by Vaidehi while she was being abducted.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Sita, for sure, dropped these ornaments on the grassy ground. They are in good shape (without any damage).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed by Rama, Lakshmana replied, 'I recognise neither the armlets nor the earrings. I only recognise the anklets as I used to bow at her feet daily.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Rama said to Sugriva,.'Tell me, O Sugriva, to which region that fiercelooking demon has carried away my Sita, who is dearer than my life.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Rama said to Sugriva,.'Tell me, O Sugriva, to which region that fiercelooking demon has carried away my Sita, who is dearer than my life.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Let me know where dwells that huge  ogre who has caused this agony to me. I will exterminate all the demons
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'By abducting Maithili he has stirred my fierce anger and has opened the door of his death.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O lord of monkeys tell me the whereabouts of that nightranger who has carried off my darling from the heart of the forest and has harassed her. I will send him now to the abode of Death. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षष्ठस्सर्गः Thus ends the sixth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana,  the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 6 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the words of Rama in deep distress, the monkey replied to him with folded hands, his throat choked with tears:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I do not have any knowledge of this sinful demon's dwelling , his capability, his valour or his clan or his despicable lineage.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O subduer of enemies, give up sorrow. I promise I will make necessary effort so that you will obtain the princess from Mithila.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'With all my capability I will kill Ravana and his clan. Thus I will be able to satisfy you soon with my efforts.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Give up despair. It is enough. Be patient. Maintain your natural disposition.It is unworthy of men like you to entertain such frivolus thoughts?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Separated from my wife, I, too, am afflicted with deep grief. But I do not brood, I do not lose patience.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am an ordinary monkey born. Even then, I do not brood over my wife. You are highsouled, humble and patient. Why do you grieve?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Restrain the flow of your tears. Be  patient. Men (like you) endowed with  equilibrium and dignity and patience ought not to leave their composure.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In times of grief or loss of wealth or at the hour of death, one who is patient does not abandon his wisdom, he does not despair.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A man who is unwise and distraught only gets sunk in grief like a heavily loaded boat (sinks) in water.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I implore you with folded palms on account of our friendship to show manliness. You should not give in to grief.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There is no happiness for those who give way to sorrow. Their brilliance is dimmed. Therefore, you ought not grieve.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Even the chances of survival are doubtful for a man who is overpowered by sorrow. Give up sorrow and have patience, O king
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Out of friendly concern I offer my opinion in your interest. I am not competent to advise you. Respecting my friendship, you should never yield to grief.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Consoled by the sweet words of Sugriva, Rama wiped his face filled with tears by the hem of his upper cloth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When lord Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha race was comforted by these words of Sugriva, he came to his senses, and clasping him said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Sugriva you have done what a friend should have done in a befitting manner with your sweet words and good wishes.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O friend you have guided me back to my senses thus. It is difficult to find a friend like you specially at this time.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Indeed, you must make effort to trace the princess from Mithila and the evilminded, fierce  demon Ravana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Now tell me about my duty without any hesitation. I assure you that your desire will be fulfilled, just as seeds sown in a fertile land with timely rains bear fruit.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O tiger amongst monkeys accept my words uttered out of injured honour in their true sense.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I have never uttered a false word earlier nor will I do it in future. This is my promise. I swear by truth alone.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva and his counsellors felt glad on hearing Rama's words, particularly  the assurance given by him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Man and monkey then met privately and shared the weal and woe of one another.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Wise Sugriva, chief of monkeys, heard the words of the magnanimous Rama, a bull among men. He felt glad at heart thinking that his task has been achieved. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the seventh sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 7 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva, the monkey was very pleased with Rama's words and said to him in front of Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Since one like you endowed with all virtues has become my friend I am (now) worthy of grace of the gods in all respects. There is no doubt.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, my sinless Lord, it is possible to attain even the kingdom of the gods with your help, what  to speak of my own kingdom?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, since you, born in Raghava dynasty, have become my friend with fire as witness, I have become equally honourable among my relatives and friends.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You will come to know slowly that I am also a friend worthy of you.It is not proper for me to speak of my qualities( flatter myself).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The affection of exalted souls is exceedingly stable like the patience of  selfcontrolled and wellcomposed men like you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Good friends consider(valuables such as) silver or gold, clothes or ornaments of worldly wealth indivisible.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Whether rich or poor, afflicted or happy, flawless or guilty, a friend is the ultimate refuge to a friend.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'One will not hesitate to sacrifice wealth or happiness or even life for the sake of a friend like you.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As wise Lakshmana, brilliant like Indra stood witness, Rama said, 'it is true as you say' to Sugriva who spoke pleasing words.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With mighty Rama and Lakshmana standing by, Sugriva cast his eyes eagerly all round the forest.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the chief of monkeys saw a sala tree looking lovely with tender leaves and flowers graced by bees.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva cut a branch of the beautifully blossomed sala tree with plenty of leaves,   spread it (on the ground) and squatted along with Rama.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter Hanuman also broke a branch of the sala tree and seated Lakshmana on it.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Now Rama, seated comfortably on the best of mountains overgrown with trees full of flowers and fruits, appeared tranguil like an ocean. Extremely delighted and excited, Sugriva spoke to Rama words that got mixed up with softness and sweetness out of love:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Now Rama, seated comfortably on the best of mountains overgrown with trees full of flowers and fruits, appeared tranguil like an ocean. Extremely delighted and excited, Sugriva spoke to Rama words that got mixed up with softness and sweetness out of love:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am sadly roaming here in the great Rishyamuka mountain, my wife stolen, offended by my brother and frightened.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama my brother is my enemy. Deceived and threatened by him, I live in the forest stricken with fear and utterly confused.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O great warrior who can frighten all the worlds scared of Vali, I feel  helpless like an orphan to whom you ought to extend your grace.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus spoken to, the glorious Rama, lover of righteousness who knew his duty, replied to Sugriva with a smile on his face:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'While a friend is known for his help, an enemy is known for his offensiveness. I will this very day kill the one who wrested your wife.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Here are my highspeed, winged arrows glowing like fierce fire, born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds.They are smooth and welljointed, decked with gold, comparable in strength to great Indra's thunderbolt, very sharp with pointed tips looking like angry serpents.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Here are my highspeed, winged arrows glowing like fierce fire, born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds.They are smooth and welljointed, decked with gold, comparable in strength to great Indra's thunderbolt, very sharp with pointed tips looking like angry serpents.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vali who calls himself your brother is your enemy and a doer of wrong deeds. You will see him crushed, like a mountain shattered, by my arrows.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing Rama's words, Sugriva, chief of the army of monkeys experienced immeasurable happiness and exclaimed, 'you're great, you're great.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Rama I am overwhelmed with sorrow. You are the refuge of the distressed. As you are a friend I ventilate all my grief to you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I value your hand of friendship extended to me, with fire as witness more than my very life. I, on my own, offer my pledge of friendship.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: His vision blurred, words choked with tears he was unable to speak further.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Quickly Sugriva controlled his tears streaming fast like the rushing river, with patience, Rama seated in front.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Effulgent Sugriva controlled his tears, wiped his bright eyes, took deep breath and said to Rama:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama I was subjected to the harsh words of powerful Vali in the past when he uprooted me from  the kingdom and threw me out.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I was robbed of my wife who is dearer than my own life. All my friends were rounded up and imprisoned.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama this evilminded one made several attempts to kill me. The monkeys he sent to kill me were themselves killed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It is because of suspicion that I did not approach you. Every one is scared when there is ample reason to fear.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Only Hanuman and other chiefs are helping me. Therefore, I am surviving in spite of all difficulties.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'These monkeys out of love for me keep me protected from all sides. They go out with me when it is necessary and stay back whenever I stop (in order to guard me).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama I tell you (my story) briefly. It is not necessary to go into details. My elder brother Vali, who is known for his prowess, is my enemy.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'My sorrow will go only with his death. My happiness and my life are also subject to his destruction.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This what I had to tell you out of sorrow. This is how my sorrow will end. In joy and in sorrow your friend is your refuge.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After hearing  Sugriva, Rama said 'I wish to know the actual cause of this enmity.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On hearing the cause of your enmity and considering your strength and weakness, I will take steps to make you happy.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On hearing about your humiliation I feel highly agitated at heart. I feel very much angry and restless like the water in rainy season.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Tell me freely and cheerfully before I string the bow. Your enemy will be destroyed as soon as I release my arrow.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When the great Rama said this, Sugriva with all the four monkeys felt immeasurably glad.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With a smile on his face, Sugriva started narrating to Lakshmana's elder brother the facts about the cause of his enmity (with Vali). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टमस्सर्गः Thus ends the eighth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 8 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'My elder brother called Vali, capable of exterminating enemies was always highly regarded by my father and me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I served him obediently like a servant while he ruled over the great  ancestral kingdom inherited by him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Dundubhi's eldest son Mayabi was a mighty demon. He developed bitter enmity with Vali for the sake of a woman.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'One midnight when all were asleep, he (Mayabi) came to the entrance of Kishkinda screaming angrily and bellowing at Vali, challenging him to a duel.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: ' My brother Vali, who was asleep could not tolerate the frightful sound and jumped out of bed hastily.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Enraged, he came out to kill the powerful demon even though I with the womenfolk (of the harem) tried to prevent him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'That mighty warrior(Vali) came out, pushing aside all the womenfolk. I too followed  him due to my affection towards him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On seeing my brother and me from a distance, the demon took to his heels scared.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Frightened, he ran. We too chased him running faster. As the Moon was rising the path was welllit.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The demon entered into a hole (cave) covered with a heap of grass, difficult, therefore, of access. Both of us reached there and took position.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Seeing the enemy entering the cave, Vali became wrathful and his senses were terribly disturbed.He said to me:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Sugriva wait here at the entrance of the cave and be on your alert until I enter this hole and kill the enemy'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On hearing him, I begged the scorcher of enemies (Vali) that I would follow him, but he made me swear on his feet and entered the cave.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Thinking him dead, I became agitated because of my love for him. My mind began to apprehend his death since I had not seen my brother for long.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I heard the roaring voices of the demons and not the yelling of my brother engaged in the duel.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O friend by those signs I understood that my brother was killed and concluding that way I blocked the entrance of the cave with a rock of the size of a mountain and offered oblations to my brother and came to Kishkinda. I intended to hide the fact of Vali's death. But the ministers came to know the truth with their efforts.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O friend by those signs I understood that my brother was killed and concluding that way I blocked the entrance of the cave with a rock of the size of a mountain and offered oblations to my brother and came to Kishkinda. I intended to hide the fact of Vali's death. But the ministers came to know the truth with their efforts.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then all the ministers assembled together and consecrated me. While I was ruling the kingdom lawfully, Vali, the monkey came back after killing the enemy demon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Seeing me on the throne, Vali became angry and his eyes turned red. He imprisoned my ministers and spoke to me harshly.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama even though I was capable of restraining the sinner, my intellect did not let me do so out of respect for my brother.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When my brother came back to the town after killing the enemy, I offered as usual my salutations to him. But he did not bless me wholeheartedly.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When my brother came back to the town after killing the enemy, I offered as usual my salutations to him. But he did not bless me wholeheartedly.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O lord I bowed at his feet with my crown in total submission. Even then Vali was not pleased a bit. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे नवमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the ninth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 9 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I sought to appease my brother who arrived in an agitated state overpowered with anger.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'By providence you have come back safe and the enemy has been killed. You are the only protector to an orphan which I am.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Here is the manyribbed parasol shining like the full Moon above the horizon and the yak's tailfan held by me.Pray accept it.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king I waited at the entrance of the cave for a year. As you did not come out, I felt distressed and my heart sank in great sorrow seeing blood flowing out of the cave. With my senses fused I returned to Kishkinda, closing the entrance with a rock(lest the demon should come out).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king I waited at the entrance of the cave for a year. As you did not come out, I felt distressed and my heart sank in great sorrow seeing blood flowing out of the cave. With my senses fused I returned to Kishkinda, closing the entrance with a rock(lest the demon should come out).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Here I was consecrated by the people and ministers who saw me immersed in grief. It was not my desire to be coronated. Therefore, I may be forgiven.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You alone are the king and worthy of reverence.I will be the same old brother carrying out my work as earlier. I held the responsibility of the state in your absence forced by the citizens and ministers. The kingdom has been kept stable with the enemies destroyed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You alone are the king and worthy of reverence.I will be the same old brother carrying out my work as earlier. I held the responsibility of the state in your absence forced by the citizens and ministers. The kingdom has been kept stable with the enemies destroyed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am handing over this kingdom which was in trust. O slayer of enemies, O good natured one, give up your anger against me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king I bow my head and beg you with folded hands. The ministers and citizens assembled and forced me to take charge, as the kingdom without a ruler was vulnerable to attack.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Even tnough I spoke to him with affection, Vali abused me in many words, saying, 'Fie on you'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having invited ordinary people and favourite ministers he condemned me in the presence of friends.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You know very well how that wicked demon, Mayabi, that night challenged me angrily to a duel.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On hearing his words I came out of the royal abode quickly, followed by this wicked brother.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The powerful demon that night saw me followed by another advancing towards him and fled out of fear. When we chased him, he entered this huge cave in great speed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The powerful demon that night saw me followed by another advancing towards him and fled out of fear. When we chased him, he entered this huge cave in great speed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When I saw the dreadful demon entering the great cave, I instructed this cruel brother of mine:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I cannot return from here without killing him. Wait at the entrance of the cave until I kill him. Look forward to my return.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Presuming that Sugriva was waiting there, I entered the formidable cave. While I was searching for the demon there, one year passed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I could find that fearful enemy there and killed him along with his relatives without any difficulty.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When there was no response from Sugriva to my repeated call in distress I was very sad.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I kicked the boulder again and again till it yielded. I came out that way and arrived at the city.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I was obstructed by wicked Sugriva who forgot his brotherly love and was desiring  the kingdom, which belongs to me.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When Vali, the monkey, spoke that way I remained unperturbed. He banished me  with the only cloth I was wearing.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama my wife has been usurped. There is the fear of his attack. So I am roaming this entire earth, covered with forests and oceans.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Tormented by the abduction of my wife by Vali, I came to the great Rishyamuka mountain  inaccessible to Vali for some other reason.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama I have given you this long, full account of the cause of our enmity. For no fault of mine I am suffering.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O great warrior you are one who can frighten the entire world Due to the fear of Vali I seek your grace.You may resist Vali and provide me security.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having thus addressed by Sugriva the righteous and glorious Rama with a gentle smile  consistent with righteousness, started speaking:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'These my sharp, unfailing arrows, bright as the Sun, released by me out of anger will descend on the evildoer, Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'That sinful Vali who has abducted your wife and violated the moral code will live only as long I do not see him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Inferring from my own experience, I see that you are immersed in an ocean of sorrow.I will help you cross over and fulfil your desire.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing his words that boosted his joy and vigour, Sugriva was immensely pleased and said these warm words. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गः Thus ends the tenth sarga of Kishkindhakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 10 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The words of Rama boosted Sugriva's joy and manliness. He offered him prayers and praise:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There is no doubt that your sharp, blazing arrows will pierce through the vital parts of the body once you are angry, just as the Sungod burns all worlds at the end of the Yuga.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In the early hours before Sunrise Vali crosses over the oceans from the west to the east and moving from south to north (performing sandhya) without getting fatigued.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Climbing up speedily, valiant Vali would catch the huge mountain peaks.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vali would break several sturdy trees in the forest with his vigour and speed, exhibiting his strength.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Massive like the shining peak of mount Kailas and valiant like the mightybuffalo in form, Dundubhi possessed the strength of a thousand elephants.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Wicked Dundubhi of huge body was proud of his valour and deluded by virtue of the boons, went to the ocean, the lord of rivers.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Reaching the mighty ocean, he implored the sea with (high) waves and hoards of gems for a fight.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king, then the powerful and righteous king of the ocean came out and spoke to the demon (Dundubhi) who was driven to death by fate.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are proficient in warfare. I am not competent enough to challenge you to a duel. But  I will name the one who can.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Himavan, the supreme abode of ascetics is the fatherinlaw of Lord Siva. He is wellknown as king of mountains, who has, waterfalls, caves, caverns and great forests.He is competent to match your incomparable love for war.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Himavan, the supreme abode of ascetics is the fatherinlaw of Lord Siva. He is wellknown as king of mountains, who has, waterfalls, caves, caverns and great forests.He is competent to match your incomparable love for war.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Dundubhi, the most powerful of demons, aware that the ocean is frightened of him went swiftly to Himavan like an arrow released from a bow. He raised many huge white cliffs of the size of great elephants to the ground and roared.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Dundubhi, the most powerful of demons, aware that the ocean is frightened of him went swiftly to Himavan like an arrow released from a bow. He raised many huge white cliffs of the size of great elephants to the ground and roared.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then the gentle Himavan of pleasing appearance stood in the form of a white cloud on the peak and spoke:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Dundubhi, it is not proper for you to trouble me, for I am devoted to righteousness. I am the resort of ascetics and not adept in warfare'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: "At these words of Himavan, the wise king of mountains, Dundubhi whose eyes turned red in anger replied:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If you are unable or unwilling to fight me out of fear, tell me who wants to challenge me to a duel.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On hearing such words, which no one had spoken earlier, righteous Himavan, skilful in conversation, flew into a rage and said to Dundubhi,the best of demons:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vali, son of Indra, is a wise, powerful and prosperous monkey. He resides at Kishkinda, a city of incomparable glory.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vali is profoundly wise, an expert in warfare. He is capable of challenging you to a duel like Indra to Namuchi.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If you wish to fight, go to him quickly.He is ever heroic and difficult to combat.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having heard Himavan, Dundubhi, seized with anger, went to Kishkindha,  the city of Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Mighty Dundubhi assuming the form of a frightening buffalo with pointed horns looking like a huge, dark raincloud in the sky in monsoon marched to the entrance of Kishkinda and roared like a wardrum as if shaking the earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Mighty Dundubhi assuming the form of a frightening buffalo with pointed horns looking like a huge, dark raincloud in the sky in monsoon marched to the entrance of Kishkinda and roared like a wardrum as if shaking the earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Dundubhi felled the trees nearby, rent the earth with its hoofs, scratched the entrance gate of the city as an elephant would do with its horns in arrogance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Unable to tolerate the sound, Vali jumped out of the harem along with the women like the Moon with stars.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vali, king of the monkeys who roam the forest, saw Dundubhi and addressed, but briefly:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Dundubhi why are you roaring, blocking the entrance of the city? I know you are powerful. Go and save your life.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Dundubhi whose eyes turned red in anger when he heard the words of Vali ,the wise king of the monkeys, said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O hero speaking such words in the presence of women is not proper. Come to me for a combat and I will let you know your strength.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkey I will restrain my anger tonight and give you time for your indulgence in sensual pleasures till morning.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king of monkeys, hug them and give them any gift you want. Spend the night with your dear ones.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Have a good look a Kishkinda. Assign some one like you kingship. Sport freely  with women and come, I shall destroy your arrogance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Whoever kills a person, who is drunk or is heedless or is asleep or without weapons or stupified by lust in this world, is equal to a killer of a foetus in the womb.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then, Vali sent away Tara and all other women slowly and replied angrily to the foolish demon with a mischievous smile:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Do not consider me drunken. This drink will serve as a warrior's drink in the combat. Be ready, if you are not afraid of a combat.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having addressed thus in a rage, Vali removed the golden garland gifted by Indra, his father, and stood ready for the combat.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vali, the elephantlike monkey then held the mountainlike Dundubhi by the horns and struck him down, roaring loudly.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vali whirled him round and round and threw him downroaring. Blood flowed from Dundubhi's ears.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Each one of them was highly agitated and angry trying to win over the other. A terrific fight took place between Dundubhi and Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then Vali who was equal to Indra in prowess fought, hitting him with fists, knees, rocks and trees.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then as the monkey and demon fought pouncing on each other, the prowess of Dundubhi got diminished and that of Vali, the son of Indra, increased.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In the fight, Dundubhi fell down, with his strength, courage and prowess dwindled. Vali lifted his huge body and dashed it down on the ground. The body of Dundubhi dissolved into the five elements.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In the fight, Dundubhi fell down, with his strength, courage and prowess dwindled. Vali lifted his huge body and dashed it down on the ground. The body of Dundubhi dissolved into the five elements.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Mighty Vali lifted on both shoulders the insensate body drained of life and hurled it speedily to a distance of a yojana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Scattered by the wind, drops of blood fell at the hermitage of Matanga from the mouth of the deadbody flung.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The venerable sage became furious to see drops of blood fallen there. He started thinking who could he be?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Who is that petty, wicked, evil minded one who caused the drops of blood to touch (fall on) me suddenly?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The venerable sage came out of the hermitage and saw a mountaneous buffalo fallen dead on the floor.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having known through his ascetic vision that it was the act of a monkey, he pronounced a curse on Vali who had hurled (the body):
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Whoever has desecrated this forest, protected by me, with drops of blood is forbidden to enter this place. Once he does it, he will die.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Whoever has broken the trees all over this forest and has thrown the demon's body will not survive if he enters within a radius of one yojana  of my hermitage.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Indeed his counsellors who are here must leave this forest. Let them depart safely.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If the monkeys stay back to destroy the leaves and shoots and plunder the fruits and roots of this forest which I have protected just like my son will also certainly invite my curse.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If the monkeys stay back to destroy the leaves and shoots and plunder the fruits and roots of this forest which I have protected just like my son will also certainly invite my curse.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I give one day's time for the monkeys (to leave). Whomsoever, I see tomorrow will get transformed into a mountain for many thousands of years'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The monkeys fled on hearing the words spoken by the sage. Said Vali:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Why have you, residents of the groves of Matanga, come to me? Hope all are safe'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then all the monkeys collected together and narrated everything about the curse given to Vali , adorned with a golden chain(on his neck).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On hearing the monkeys, Vali went to the sage and begged forgiveness with folded hands.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The sage went into the hermitage without obliging Vali who became apprehensive of the curse of the sage.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lord Rama because of the fear of the curse, Vali will not enter the great Rishyamuka mountain nor will he like to see it.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama aware of the prohibition of Vali from entering the place, I roam about this great forest  accompanied by my ministers without any apprehension.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Hurled with the pride of his(Vali's) prowess is this heap of bones of Dundubhi here, which shines like a huge mountain peak.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look at these seven sturdy Sala trees with branches  of one overlapping the other.  Vali was able to remove all the leaves of one Sala tree with just one arrow.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama Vali's strength and fame related by me is unequalled. O king how is it possible for you to kill him in a combat?'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Smiling, Lakshmana asked Sugriva, 'By what action will you trust?. By the fulfilment of which task (by Rama) will you have faith?'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Sugriva told Lakshmana that earlier Vali had split through these seven Sala trees one after the other, several times.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If I see Rama splitting these trees with one arrow, I will believe he can kill Vali with his prowess.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lakshmana and if Rama can also lift the dead buffalo's (Dundubhi's) skeleton and hurl it to a distance  of two hundred bows with one of his feet.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having said this and thinking for a moment, Sugriva again said to the heroic Rama whose eyes had turned red.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Powerful Vali is valiant and has killed brave fighters. He is wellknown for his prowess and valour. He has not faced defeat in war.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Even gods cannot do what he has done. Thinking of all this and being afraid of him, I have taken refuge at Rishyamuka.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Thinking that this indignant, invincible lord of the monkeys, cannot be overpowered, I have not stepped out of Rishyamuka.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I have discovered in you a faithful friend. O tiger among men, O venerable one, you are to me like the Himalayas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'What to do? I know the strength of my mighty bad brother. But so far I have not seen your power in a battle.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The dreadful acts of Vali have made me feel timid. This is not to compare you with him or your strength with his or insult you and scare you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Rama  your word and your courage indicate your supreme strength which is like fire covered with ashes.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard the great Sugriva, Rama replied with a gentle smile:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If you have no confidence in my strength in fight, O monkey, I will create it in you so much so that you will admire it.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama,the mighty elder brother of Lakshmana, having said so to Sugriva in a pleasing manner, lifted the dried body of Dundubhi easily with his toe, shook it and flung it with ease to a distance of ten yojanas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama,the mighty elder brother of Lakshmana, having said so to Sugriva in a pleasing manner, lifted the dried body of Dundubhi easily with his toe, shook it and flung it with ease to a distance of ten yojanas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having seen Rama flinging the body, Sugriva said to him again in the presence of Lakshmanameaningfully:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O friend, when Vali my brother flung the body, he was tired and intoxicated and the body was fresh with flesh (meaning heavy), but now, O Delight of the Raghu race, it is fleshless and light like a bunch of (dry) grass (for) which you could throw it playfully.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O friend, when Vali my brother flung the body, he was tired and intoxicated and the body was fresh with flesh (meaning heavy), but now, O Delight of the Raghu race, it is fleshless and light like a bunch of (dry) grass (for) which you could throw it playfully.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I was unable to gauge whether your strength is more  than his (Vali's) since there is a great difference between a dry body and a wet one.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Dear, therefore, I have my doubt about your relative strength. If you can split a sala tree with a single arrow then can your strength or weakness be demonstrated.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Now string your bow, draw it like the trunk of an elephant up to your ear and release the great arrow.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It will be enough and my doubt will be cleared. If you can pierce the sala tree with your arrow it will be my pleasure and not a test of your strength.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Just as the Sun is the best among the brilliant, the Himalayas among the great mountains, the lion among the quadrupeds, so also you are the best among men of valour.' इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकादशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends  the eleventh sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 11 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard Sugriva's pleasing words, the brilliant Rama took up the bow in order to inspire confidence in Sugriva.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, subduer of the enemy's pride, strung his terrific bow, produced the twang that filled all directions, and discharged a single arrow aimed at the sala tree.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Released with great force, Rama's arrow embellished with gold pierced through the seven sala trees and splitting the mountain terrain entered the earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In a moment the arrow emerged from the earth which it pierced and reentered the quiver with great speed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The chief of the monkeys was struck with wonder seeing Rama's arrow piercing through  the seven sala trees so swiftly.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva was immensely happy and offered obeisance to Rama with folded hands and bowed down and prostrated while his ornaments touched the ground.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva who stood by, elated to watch the deed of Rama, best among the valiant, proficient in the use of arms of all kinds and knower of dharma, said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O bull among men, O lord, you are capable of killing with your arrows even the gods including Indra in the battle, what to speak of Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama who can in a battle confront you, capable of splitting seven huge sala trees, the mountain and the earth with a single arrow?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having found a friend in you comparable to Indra and Varuna, my grief is gone and I am so happy now.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.
