instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, for my pleasure kill Vali who is, to me, an enemy in the guise of a brother. I fold my hands to you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then wise Rama embraced handsome Sugriva and replied in these words which were agreeable to Lakshmana:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Sugriva, get ready at once. We will promptly proceed to Kishkinda from here. Go ahead and challenge Vali, your brother only in name, to a combat.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thay all rushed to Kishkinda, the capital of Vali and waited in the thick forest behind the trees.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva tightened up his waist cloth hurriedly and roared terrifically as though piercing the sky. And screamed  for Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing his brother roaring, powerful Vali was enraged and rushed like the Sun from behind the western shore of the ocean (this simile suggests the downfall of Vali).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then a tumultuous combat took place between Vali and Sugriva who looked like the planets Mercury and Mars.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The brothers, insensate with fury, struck each other like thunder with their palms, soles  and fists in the combat.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Bow in hand, Rama watched both the heroes who resembled the twin Aswini Kumaras.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Since Rama was not able to distinguish between Vali and Sugriva, he could not decide whether he should discharge his deadly arrow .
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Discomfited  by Vali, and not seeing Rama around, Sugriva ran towards Rishyamuka mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Exhausted, disfigured and body mauled and drenched in blood all over, Sugriva, chased by the infuriated Vali, entered the region of  great sage Matanga.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Effulgent Vali saw Sugriva entering the (prohibited) grove and turned back due to the fear of the curse (of sage Matanga) saying, 'You have escaped'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama together with Lakshmana and Hanuman also arrived at the same gave where  Sugriva was.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: At the sight of Rama accompanied by Lakshmana, Sugriva felt ashmed and aggrieved, and looking down on the ground, said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You demonstrated your prowess and directed me to challenge Vali and then why did you make the enemy hit me thus?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Had you, in fact, told me that you were not going to kill Vali, I would not have budged from this place.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the great Sugriva's miserable and moving words, Rama again said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O dear Sugriva dispel your anger and listen to me why I had not released the arrow.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Sugriva in form, ornaments and movements there is perfect resemblance between you and Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkey in your voice, in brightness, in looks, in valour or in words I have marked no difference between you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O distinguished monkey you both are so similar in form that I was puzzled and did not release my swift arrow that could have destroyed the enemy.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I was doubtful because of your similar appearance. I thought that I should not strike at the very root of the interests of both of us. Therefore, I did not release the terrific and deadly  arrow.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O lord of monkeys I would have betrayed my foolishness and childishness had I exposed you to danger by my ignorance and thoughtlessness.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It is said that killing a person to whom protection is promised is highly sinful. Lakshmana, darling Sita and me, are under your care and you are our refuge.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Therefore, O monkey, go and engage yourself in fight again. Do not suspect me. With this single arrow of mine, in one moment you will see Vali thrown down and rolling on the ground in this combat.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Therefore, O monkey, go and engage yourself in fight again. Do not suspect me. With this single arrow of mine, in one moment you will see Vali thrown down and rolling on the ground in this combat.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O lord of monkeys while you both are engaged in a duel wear some identification mark by which I can recognise you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Lakshmana this Gajapushpi  in bloom is auspicious. Pluck and fasten it on great Sugriva's neck.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Lakshmana went to the mountain slope, plucked the (creeper with) gajapuspi blossoms and fastened it on the neck of Sugriva.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With the creeper round the neck, Sugriva looked like the raincloud at twilight, adorned by a row of cranes like a garland.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Radiant Sugriva intent on carrying out Rama's words again went to Kishkinda ruled by Vali. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 12 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Lakshmana's righteous elder brother left Rishyamuka with Sugriva for Kishkinda protected by Vali's valour.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Getting ready to go, Rama took up his great bow and arrows adorned with gold and potent in war looking (dazzling) like the Sun.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The strongnecked Sugriva and mighty Lakshmana walked in front of the highsouled Rama.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Brave and brilliant Hanuman, Nala, Nila, and Tara among the leaders of the monkeys  walked behind.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They saw (on the way) trees bent down with the load of flowers, and rivers with pure water flowing into the sea.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: (They saw) beautiful valleys, mountains, caves, prominent peaks with deep caverns.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Observing on the way delightful lotus buds with leaves like Vaidurya, clear water and full tanks (They moved on).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Ducks, cranes, swans, vanjulas, waterfowls, chakravakas and other birds warbling melodiously.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They observed deer feeding on tender grass on the ground around without fear, some standing and some roaming the forest
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Observing terrific elephants adorned with white tusks wandering alone destroying the tanks, shattering the banks.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: (Observing) intoxicated elephants knocking the edges of mountain slopes, elephants resembling (dark) rainbearing clouds, elephants like moving mountains, elephants with dust covered all over the body.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Following Sugriva faithfully, they proceeded swiftly, observing animals of the forest and birds flying in the sky.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While walking fast, looking at the forest full of trees Rama, the delight of the Raghus said to Sugriva:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This cluster of trees surrounded by plantain groves look splendid like a vast collection of clouds in the sky.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O friend I wish to know what this is? Could you answer my curiosity?'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing great Rama's words while walking in the extensive forest,  Sugriva started narrating:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Raghava this is a hermitage, enchanting with vast gardens and trees bearing sweet fruits, full of tasty roots and water that relieves tiresomeness (of travellers).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'These seven sages used to live on air and that too once in seven nights. They lived for seven hundred years performing penance with motionlessness and attained heaven along with their bodies.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'By virtue of the power of their penance, this hermitage surrounded by a row of trees is impenetrable even for demons and gods including Indra.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Birds and wild animals avoid the hermitage and whoever enters there out of ignorance never returns.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, one can hear pleasant sounds of jingling ornaments (of nymphs), of songs and windinstruments here. One can inhale divine fragrance, too.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The three sacred fires keep burning and the thick smoke they emit resembles the red feet of  pigeons. It shines forth as if enveloping the treetops.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'These treetops covered with thick smoke glow like mountains of Vaidurya concealed by a cluster of clouds.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O rigteous Rama you and your brother Lakshmana humbly offer obeisance to them(sacred hermitage and sages Saptajana) with folded hands and meditate on them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama, nothing inauspicious happens to them who offer obeisance to those highly spiritual sacred sages.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana  offered salutations with folded hands in memory of those great sages, great souls.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Righteous Rama, Lakshmana, Sugriva and all the monkeys offered obeisance and proceeded delighted at heart.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Walking a long distance from the hermitage of the seven seers, they beheld the unassailable Kishkinda ruled by Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama and Lakshmana of fierce lustre, and the monkeys took hold of the weapons to kill the enemy and reached the capital ruled by the valour of Vali, son of Indra. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 13 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They all at once went to Kishkinda ruled by Vali and there waited hiding behind the trees in the dense forest.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Broadnecked Sugriva, a lover of the forest, looked around and flew into a rage.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva, surrounded by his companions, raised his voice as if piercing the sky, roaring like a huge thundering cloud, challenging Vali to a duel.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva, proficient in the performance of any task, one who appeared like the rising Sun and moved like a proud lion, said to Rama:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We have arrived at Kishkinda, the capital of Vali, decorated with flags and having a glittering golden archway that can be opened mechanically. Teeming with monkeys, it looks like a snare to catch the enemy.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O heroic Rama fulfil quickly the vow taken by you earlier to kill Vali in the same way  a creeper bears fruit when the time comes.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Requested thus by Sugriva, righteous Rama, the destroyer of enemies, replied:.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Lakshmana has uprooted a creeper of  gaja, and fastened it on your neck by which you can be easily identified.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O hero, you are shining with the creeper fastened to your neck , just as the fullmoon adorned with a cluster of stars shines in the sky.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkey, with the release of a single arrow in the combat, I shall dispel your fear and enmity (hatred) for Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Sugriva show me your enemy,who is in the guise of your brother.He will be killed. He will roll down in the dust of the forest.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If Vali appears before me I will not let him go with life.Then you will not blame me and find fault with me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You have seen how I have pierced through seven sala trees with a single arrow. You will know how with the same strength I will kill Vali.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Sugriva, I have uttered no falsehood before for fear of deviation from righteousness although I was in distress, nor shall I utter any falsehood in any circumstances hereafter.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I shall fulfil my promise just as Indra (who performed a hundred sacrifices) helps production in the cornfield through timely rain. Give up your apprehension.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Sugriva give a warcry so that Vali adorned with a golden garland will come out.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vali, who is proud of  his valour,  is strong, fearless and fond of combat, will rush out of the city in response to your challenge.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Proud of their own prowess, heroes will not brook the challenge of foes in battle, specially in the presence of women.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing Rama's words, the goldenhued Sugriva roared in a fierce voice as if it would piece  the sky.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Alarmed at the yelling of Sugriva, the cows began to run in all directions, like the  women of noble pedigree who, with their brightness lost, run perplexed for failure of the king to protect their chastity.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The deer were unable to run like wounded horses in a battle. Birds fell down on the ground like planets fall when their merit is exhausted.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Sugriva, son of the Sungod, with his lustre enhanced by his valour moved swiftly. His roar resembled the rumbling of a cluster of thundering clouds. He gave a warcry the tone of which resembled the sounds of waves lashed by high velocity winds in the sea. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 14 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The indignant Vali, who was in the harem, heard the roaring of his venerable brother, Sugriva.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The roar (of Sugriva) that frightened all beings gave Vali's vanity a jolt and at once   aroused in him violent rage.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Overcome with anger, Vali looked pale like the eclipsed Sun with the golden radiance faded from  his face.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vali, who looked fierce with his teeth and whose eyes shone like a flaming fire through anger looked like a pond with the lotuses and their stalks uprooted.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Unable to tolerate Sugriva's roar, Vali stepped out hurriedly, taking long strides as if breaking the earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Tara, perplexed out of fear, glanced at Vali lovingly, embraced him and gave him wise counsel:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O valiant Vali anger has overtaken you like the flood of a river. It is natural for you to be angry at this time, but shake off your anger just as the wise discard a flower  garland already used up.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkey fight him only tomorrow morning. By this you are not going to prove your weakness or increase your respect for the enemy.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I do not like your rashness. I will explain the reason I am preventing you. Listen:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Earlier, he (Sugriva) came  and challenged you to a duel. You struck him in anger, and defeated, he fled, running in all directions. Now his challenge rouses my suspicion.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'One who is defeated and badly mauled by you is again coming and inviting you to a duel in this manner arouses suspicion in me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'His determination, his insolence, his roaring, his arroganceall this cannot be for a small reason.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Certainly Sugriva has not come here to give a warcry without any external help. The person whose refuge he has sought is not a small one.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Sugriva is clever by nature. He is wise. Without assessing the ability of the ally he will not enter into friendship.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O hero I have heard the news earlier from our son Angada. I will tell you what he had heard and what he has said to me:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When our son Angada was out into the forest he had collected some reports from the spies which he has transmitted to me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Rama and Lakshmana, two heroic sons of the king of Ayodhya born of the Ikshvaku race, are invincible in war. They have come there to help Sugriva.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Rama, famous for crushing foes in war, like the fire that breaks out at the dissolution of the world, has slain strong enemies like Khara and will help your brother.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'He is like a sheltering tree to the virtuous, an ultimate refuge for the destitutes and a protector of the distressed. He is the sole repository of fame.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'He is endowed with the knowledge of science and scriptures. He stood by his father's command. He is like a mine of virtues just as the lord of the mountain is  a mine of minerals.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Rama is immeasurable in prowess and unconquerable in war. Therefore, enmity with him is not desirable for you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O hero, this I tell you not because I dislike you, but because I wish your welfare. Listen, and do as I say
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king O hero consecrate your brother Sugriva as prince at once. Do not create enmity with him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Leave enmity with Sugriva far behind. Make friendship with Rama. I think it is the right thing for you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This monkey is your younger brother and, therefore, deserves your protection. Whether he is here or there, he is your brother.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Indeed I do not see any of your relatives comparable to him on earth. Give up enmity with him. Give him wealth. Give him respect. Keep him by your side.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Indeed I do not see any of your relatives comparable to him on earth. Give up enmity with him. Give him wealth. Give him respect. Keep him by your side.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Extend your brotherly affection to broadnecked Sugriva. He is always your great relation. There is no alternative for you other than this at present.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Pray, do me this favour. Treat me as your wellwisher. Heed my  advice given with care.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Do not lose your temper. Quieten your mind. My advice is beneficial to you. You should not  fight with the prince of Kosala who is comparable to Indra in splendour.It is not proper for you.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even though Tara gave good counsel to Vali at the hour of destruction, the advice did not find favour with him as he was under the influence of unfavourable time (seized by death). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चदशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fifteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 15 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To these words of Tara with her Moonlike face, Vali replied reproachfully:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O lady with a charming face why should I tolerate the enemy (Sugriva) who is none other than my own younger brother, especially when he roars excitedly?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O timid lady to swallow insult (without facing the opponent) is worse than death for indomitable heroes (like me) who know no retreat in a battle.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When the weaknecked Sugriva roars eager to join a duel it is not right on my part to tolerate his arrogance,much less his warcry.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You need not be concerned about me on account of Rama. How can one who knows dharma and who has a sense of gratitude commit sin?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Go back with all the women of the harem. Why do you follow me again? Your devotion towards me is evident from the sincere concern expressed by you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I shall accept the challenge and fight with Sugriva. Give up your anxiety. I will destroy  his pride, not his life.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When he faces me in the battlefield, I will hit him with trees and fists, and he will run back  for life.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'That evilminded Sugriva cannot bear my mighty, hard blows. Tara you could shower your affection on me and extend help (in passing secret information obtained through Angada)
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I make a vow even on my life and my victory. Pray return with the retinue. I will be back only after winning the encounter with my brother.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Pleasing in her words, Tara then embraced Vali and sobbing, circumambulated Vali in compliance (to his advice).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The wise counsellor, Tara bade him farewell, wishing him victory and then, overwhelmed with sorrow, entered the inner apartment followed by the womenfolk.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After Tara and other women returned to their abode, Vali departed from the city,  hissing  like a huge angry cobra.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mighty Vali, breathing heavily, looked around to find where his enemy was.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There Vali saw Sugriva in lustrous, red gold complexion standing ready for a combat steady like glowing fire.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing the great hero Sugriva standing firmly, the enraged Vali tied his upper cloth (around his loin) tightly.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vali tied up his cloth tightly, raised his fist and advanced towards Sugriva, ready for the encounter.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva also lifted his fist firmly and advanced more impatiently towards Vali adorned with a golden necklace.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: While Sugriva, expert in combat, advanced swiftly to pounce upon (his enemy), Vali whose eyes turned red in anger said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: This infuriated Sugriva who, looking at Vali, said 'This fist of mine will draw your life out, hitting your forehead'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Struck by Vali, enraged Sugriva encountered Vali more aggresively. His body drenched in blood seemed a mountain with rivulets of blood flowing.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With all his vigour, Sugriva uprooted a sala tree, pulled it out and struck Vali on the body, like a thunderbolt striking a huge mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Struck by the blows of the sala tree, Vali also lost his balance like the heavily loaded ship of a trader shaken up in the ocean.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both of them endowed with terrible strength, fierce in appearance, and each seeking the weak points of the other advanced, as fast as Garuda, striking at the enemy. Their fight grew more and more fierce like the fight between Sun and Moon in the sky.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In a short while Vali, endowed with great strength, gained the upper hand and Sugriva, son of the Sungod, was losing ground .
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With his strength waning and pride crushed, Sugriva, anguished, exhibited shrewdness.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both like Vritra and Indra fought, hitting each other again and again with trees full of branches and tops, with their hard nails akin to thunderbolts and with their fists, knees, feet, etc.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Both like Vritra and Indra fought, hitting each other again and again with trees full of branches and tops, with their hard nails akin to thunderbolts and with their fists, knees, feet, etc.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkeys, wanderers in the forest, both with blood stains fiercely clashed pointing at each other, roaring with dreadful sounds like two clouds.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Raghava perceived that the monkey king Sugriva whose strength was waning was looking again and again in all directions (seeking help).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Finding the king of the monkeys in distress, the heroic, brilliant Rama looked for an  arrow in order to kill Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama then fixed an arrow which resembled a venomous snake, on to his bow looking like the very deathwheel of Yama and stretched it fully.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As if scared by the twang of the bowstring, winged and feathered birds and animals ran frightened in different directions.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As Rama shot the mighty arrow, it went like a blazing lightning with a thunderous sound and pierced into the chest of Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the powerful monkey king Vali, who was proud of his might, fell down on earth, struck by the fast flying arrow.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vali fell lustreless on the ground. He was thrown down unconscious like the banner (hoisted in honour) of Indra on the fullmoon day of Aswayuja month.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The arrow of Rama, distinguished among men, adorned with silver and gold, which could crush the enemy shone like fire and smoke emitted from the mouth of Rudra at the time of dissolution (at the end of the aeon).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 16 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: A tyrant in war, Vali struck by4.54.24 Rama's arrow, collapsed instantaneously like a tree felled down.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Adorned with shining gold ornaments,Vali fell down with all his limbs touching the ground like Indra's flag when its ropes are loosened.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When the lord of the monkey troops fell down, it was as though the earth lost its brightness like the sky loses its brightness devoid of the Moon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even though the highsouled Vali's body had fallen on the ground, its  splendour, glow, life and valour had not left it.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As the most beautiful golden necklace, studded with diamonds, given by Indra was there on him, the life, brightness and splendour of Vali's body remained.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vali, the chief hero of the monkeys, with his golden necklace appeared like the raincloud hallowed by the glowing twilight.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even though he had fallen down, the effulgence of his necklace on his body, and the arrow pierced into his vital parts remained.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama's arrow released paved the way to heaven which was that hero's supreme destination.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama followed by Lakshmana slowly approached the longarmed, lionchested, brightfaced, tawnyeyed Vali, and admiringly observed this unchallengeable son of Indra, unassailable like Indra himself. Adorned with a golden necklace, he had fallen on the ground like fire without flame, like king Yayati descended on the earth from the celestial realm on the exhaustion of his merits, or like the Sun cast down on the earth at the end of the aeon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama followed by Lakshmana slowly approached the longarmed, lionchested, brightfaced, tawnyeyed Vali, and admiringly observed this unchallengeable son of Indra, unassailable like Indra himself. Adorned with a golden necklace, he had fallen on the ground like fire without flame, like king Yayati descended on the earth from the celestial realm on the exhaustion of his merits, or like the Sun cast down on the earth at the end of the aeon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama followed by Lakshmana slowly approached the longarmed, lionchested, brightfaced, tawnyeyed Vali, and admiringly observed this unchallengeable son of Indra, unassailable like Indra himself. Adorned with a golden necklace, he had fallen on the ground like fire without flame, like king Yayati descended on the earth from the celestial realm on the exhaustion of his merits, or like the Sun cast down on the earth at the end of the aeon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama followed by Lakshmana slowly approached the longarmed, lionchested, brightfaced, tawnyeyed Vali, and admiringly observed this unchallengeable son of Indra, unassailable like Indra himself. Adorned with a golden necklace, he had fallen on the ground like fire without flame, like king Yayati descended on the earth from the celestial realm on the exhaustion of his merits, or like the Sun cast down on the earth at the end of the aeon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing powerful Rama and Lakshmana approaching,Vali spoke with pride and rigteousness to Rama, 'You are a prince, born of a noble family, son of a renowned king. You are famous, brilliant, handsome and follower of good practices.Having hit me when I was engaged otherwise in an encounter what merit have you gained?'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing powerful Rama and Lakshmana approaching,Vali spoke with pride and rigteousness to Rama, 'You are a prince, born of a noble family, son of a renowned king. You are famous, brilliant, handsome and follower of good practices.Having hit me when I was engaged otherwise in an encounter what merit have you gained?'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On seeing powerful Rama and Lakshmana approaching,Vali spoke with pride and rigteousness to Rama, 'You are a prince, born of a noble family, son of a renowned king. You are famous, brilliant, handsome and follower of good practices.Having hit me when I was engaged otherwise in an encounter what merit have you gained?'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king selfcontrol (of organs of action and sense organs), righteousness, steadfastness, truthfulness, valiance and capacity to punish the offenders are virtues  of a king.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Believing that you are a repository of all these virtues are in you, and respecting your noble lineage I engaged in a duel with Sugriva even though I was forewarned (by Tara).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I did not know that you have killed your soul (by acting against your conscience), that you are sinful in conduct and unrighteous under the show of virtues like a well, its mouth covered with grass.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are a sinful man covered with the mask of piety thus resembling a hidden fire. I failed to recognise that righteousness is a mere pretext for you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I did no harm to your affairs or to your city. I did not insult you. Why did you choose to kill me, a monkey roaming in the forest and living on fruits and roots? I was not fighting you. Why did you come and strike a person like me?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I did no harm to your affairs or to your city. I did not insult you. Why did you choose to kill me, a monkey roaming in the forest and living on fruits and roots? I was not fighting you. Why did you come and strike a person like me?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O prince, you are son to a king, handsome and famous. Even signs of righteousness are discernible in you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Who, born in a kshatriya family, versed in the Vedas and free from doubt will commit such a cruel act under the guise of righteousness?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are born in a royal family. You are wellknown. You are proficient in dharma. Yet you are unworthy  of your race and robe.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Conciliation, generosity, forbearance, righteousness, truthfulness, steadfastness in valour and punishing offenders are the hallmarks of rulers.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama we are mere animals wandering in the forest and living on roots and fruits. This is our nature. (But) you are a lord of men.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We fight for land or gold or silver. What did you fight me for, for what I have or for the fruits of the forest?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Submissiveness and modesty are the attributes of good rulers and should not be mixed up with benevolence and selfrestraint. Kings ought not to act (as they like) impulsively.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Fulfilling your own desire is important for you. You are wrathful and unstable with royal course of conduct. Your business is with your bow and arrows.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O lord of men you have no faith in righteousness, no steadfastness in the acquisition of wealth. You have no control over the senses. You are overcome by delusion.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O scion of the Kakutsthas Having killed me here with your arrow even though I have done you no harm, you have perpetrated an abominable act. How will you defend yourself in the midst of holy men after commiting such a sinful act?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'One who kills a king, a brahmin or a cow, a thief or one who delights in destruction of life an atheist or one who marries before his elder  they all go to hell.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'My skin is not fit to be worn by the virtuous, my hair and bones are also prohibited from any use. My flesh is also not at all fit to be eaten by righteous people like you
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama brahmins and kshatriyas are permitted to eat only the five nailed animals the porcupine, the hedgehog, the alligator, the rabbit and the tortoise.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king the learned do not even touch my skin or bone. They do not eat my flesh. While it is so, you have unnecessarily killed me, a fivenailed animal.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Tara knew everything. Her words were correct. They were meant for my wellbeing. However, due to my ignorance (or arrogance), I did not heed her words and fell under the sway of the lord of death
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Kakutstha just as a wife endowed with good character cannot be protected by a wicked husband, you cannot be a protector of this earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are treacherous, dishonest, mean, guised with false humility and a sinner to the core. How were you born to that highsouled Dasaratha?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Breaking through the chains of good character, trespassing the moral code of conduct of the sages, discharging the sharp arrow of righteousness, the elephantine (arrogant) Rama killed me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You have committed an inauspicious, improper act, despised by the virtuous. What will you speak when you are questioned by noble men for committing such an act?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king you have exhibited your valour against one who has done you no harm. Why have you not shown such valour on those who have offended you?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O prince had  you fought me face to face you would have seen Vaivasvata, the lord of death today (you would have been killed by me).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: bitten to death by a snake while fast asleep.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Had you sought my help earlier(before you met Sugriva), I would have restored Sita to you within a single day. I have been killed by you to oblige Sugriva. I would have handed over Ravana by the neck after killing him in the battle.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Had you sought my help earlier(before you met Sugriva), I would have restored Sita to you within a single day. I have been killed by you to oblige Sugriva. I would have handed over Ravana by the neck after killing him in the battle.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Even if she were hidden in the waters of the ocean or in the underworld, I would have brought her by your order like Sweta to Aswatari or Hayagriva. (Hayagriva, an incarnation of Visnu brought Vedas stolen by demons, Madhu and Kaitabha from Patala or the netherworld)
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Sugriva inheriting the kingdom after my departure to heaven is proper. But your killing me this way in the combat by unjustifiable means is not.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Indeed, in the world people meet with death when the time comes. Hiding yourself (from me) you have achieved it. Is it proper for you? You may think over and give your reply.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 17 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To these harsh words though seemingly wellmeaning, courteous and righteous, Vali who had been mortally wounded and confused in mind, Rama replied:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To righteous Vali,the best of the monkeys, the lord of the monkeys, who looked like the Sun shorn of his brilliance or a raindrained cloud or a fire that had been extinguished. Rama, under the scanner, said in reply:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: To righteous Vali,the best of the monkeys, the lord of the monkeys, who looked like the Sun shorn of his brilliance or a raindrained cloud or a fire that had been extinguished. Rama, under the scanner, said in reply:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Without correct knowledge of dharma, artha, kama and worldly ways, how do you reproach me bitterly now in total ignorance?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O gentle Vali why do you speak with monkeyish frivolousness, without consulting the elders and teachers endowed with intelligence?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This earth including mountains, groves and forests, animals, birds and humans belongs to the Ikshvaku kings.The right of purnishment and reward also vests with them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Bharata, righteous, truthful, upright, knower of dharma, artha and kama and dispenser of punishment and rewards, rules this earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Bharata in whom justice and discipline, truth and courage along with the knowledge of time and place for action are firmly rooted is king (of this earth).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Following his command, in confirmity with dharma we and the other kings also move all over the  entire world desirous of promoting dharma.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Who can stray from the path of dharma when the whole world is ruled by Bharata, a tiger among kings, and a lover of dharma?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'By the command of Bharata ,all of us are devoted to our duty of upholding dharma and virtue and duly punish those who deviate from the path of dharma.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You have violated dharma. You stand condemned for your actions. Passion is your priority. You have strayed from the right path of kings.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkey dharma is very subtle. It is extremely difficult to understand. Installed in the hearts of all living beings the self knows good and evil (soul is the witness of good and evil).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are fickle by nature. Your consultants are frivolous, pettyminded monkeys. It is like one born blind suppporting another blind by birth. What do you know (about dharma)?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I shall explain to you clearly (the reason for striking you down). It is not proper for you to despise me with mere anger and malice.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Now know the reason why I struck you down. Having abandoned the eternal  law, you are living with your younger brother's wife.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are a sinner, since you live with Ruma, who is your virtual daughterinlaw, when the great self Sugriva is alive. (A younger brother is like a son and his wife, a daughterinlaw).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkey since you have violated morality by sinning against your brother's wife this punishment is justified.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O lord of monkeys I do not see any other way of controlling a person excepting punishing the one who has acted against dharma and swerved from the accepted code of conduct.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am a kshatriya born of a good family. I will not pardon you for your sin. Whosoever transgresses dharma against his own daughter, sister or brother's wife out of lust should be killed according to smriti.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Bharata is a king and we follow his command. How can you, who have strayed from dharma, go unpunished?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Wise Bharata being a respectable king rules by dharma. By the command of Bharata, we are bent upon punishing those who have strayed from dharma  by being addicted to sensual pleasures.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Vali we have to follow Bharata's command and are bent upon punishing those wicked people who deviate from the bounds of dharma.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'My friendship with Sugriva is as strong as that with Lakshmana. Its motive is the recovery of his wife and sovereignty. I have  promised this to him in the presence of monkeys. How can a pledge remain unhonoured by a person like me? How is it possible?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'My friendship with Sugriva is as strong as that with Lakshmana. Its motive is the recovery of his wife and sovereignty. I have  promised this to him in the presence of monkeys. How can a pledge remain unhonoured by a person like me? How is it possible?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Knowing all these reasons(many violations of dharma), it is proper for you as a king to approve of the punishment accorded to you in consonance with dharma.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Punishment given to you should be viewed as a right course of action in all respects. This is the duty of a trustworthy friend who follows dharma.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should also have acted in that manner considering dharma. Now listen to what Manu said, in two verses that hold good traditions dear which are accepted by men wellversed in dharma. O monkey the action taken by me is in conformity with this.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should also have acted in that manner considering dharma. Now listen to what Manu said, in two verses that hold good traditions dear which are accepted by men wellversed in dharma. O monkey the action taken by me is in conformity with this.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Men who have perpetrated sins should be subjected to punishment by kings so that they become stainless and attain heaven like pious men who have performed good deeds.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In the past a similar sin was perpetrated by Sramana, a revered soul (mendicant) and Mandhata, a noble king of my race inflicted terrible punishment on him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Vicious deeds have been committed by others when the kings were not watchful. Kings punish such sinners when they are vigilant. Otherwise they have to atone for their negligence.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O tiger among monkeys do not regret. Your death has the sanction of dharma. We are under the control of sastras. We are committed to them. We do not have the freedom to act independently.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O hero O best of monkeys listen to me. I will give you one more reason. On hearing it, I hope you would not be angry with me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O best of monkeys I have no mental agony nor do I regret in this case. Hidden from view or out in the open, people catch animals by means of snares or ropes or through other tricks.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'People seeking animal flesh for food kill animals alarmed or unalarmed, animals that run away or animals that stand still. They kill animals whether they are alert or not and no blemish is attached.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'People seeking animal flesh for food kill animals alarmed or unalarmed, animals that run away or animals that stand still. They kill animals whether they are alert or not and no blemish is attached.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkey even royal saints wellversed in dharma go for hunting. I struck you down with an arrow whether you were fighting with Sugriva or not, since you are a monkey. (You can be hit whether you are fighting face to face or not).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O best of monkeys kings are donors of dharma, life and auspiciousness to people which is difficult to acquire. There is no doubt about it.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'One should not insult kings, nor shout at them, nor disregard them nor speak unpleasant words to them. They are gods in human form moving on this earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Seized with improper anger, you are reproaching one who is devoted to dharma, without knowing that I follow the code of conduct that has been passed on by my fathers and forefathers.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vali was very much pained to hear Rama. He became free from confusion regarding dharma and no longer found fault with Rama.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter Vali offered obeisance with folded palms to Rama, saying, 'O best among men whatever you have spoken is undoubtedly true.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: In Progress
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are a wise man given to truth and righteousness.You remain devoted to people's wellbeing. As you know for certain about cause and effect your intellect is sound and words pleasant.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O knower of dharma, I did not follow dharma in the past. I have trangressed the bounds of dharma. Say, you have pardoned me, protect me in a righteous manner.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I neither grieve for myself nor for Tara nor for my kinsmen. But I do for my son Angada adorned with golden armlets. He is embellished with all virtues.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I loved him very much from his childhood. He will grow depressed in my absence. He will become like a pond whose waters have been dried up.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Rama he is my only son through Tara and dear to me. He is young,innocent but strong.He  deserves to be protected by you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Shower equal affection from your heart on Sugriva and Angada. You are their protector and punisher also. You know what should and should not be done.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 18 of Valmiki Ramayana.
