input: 'There grow sandal trees of amazing colours like that of gorochana, padmaka (like lotus), greenish black and red as fire.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Never touch when you see the sandal trees, for they are guarded by dreadful gandharvas named Rohitas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Five ghandharva kings named Sailusha, Gramani, Sigru, Subhra and Babhru who have the radiance like the Sun reside there. It is the abode of those who have done meritorious deeds.They glow like Sun, Moon and Fire.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Five ghandharva kings named Sailusha, Gramani, Sigru, Subhra and Babhru who have the radiance like the Sun reside there. It is the abode of those who have done meritorious deeds.They glow like Sun, Moon and Fire.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The divine people who have earned a place in heaven stay there at the end of their life on earth. Beyond, lies the dreadful world of deceased ancestors. It is not possible for you to enter that place.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O heroic monkeys that is the capital of Yama (god of death) covered with pitch darkness. You can go till that place. Beyond, there is no access for the earthlings.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Ransack this and all other places you can see. You should search for the whereabouts of Vaidehi before you return.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'He who returns  in a month to announce Sita has been found will spend his life in luxury with as much prosperity as I do have.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'None will be dearer to me than he. Even if he has made a mistake, he will be to me dear and near.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: (Note:The Vindhya range and the several rivers mentioned here are not south of Kishkinda.The inconsistency is irreconcilable. Candidly speaking the geographical description is not at all factual. Some interpolator in the north (Kurukshetra as central region) has committed several anachronous inconsistencies betraying his ignorance of  geography.) इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्दाकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 41 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After sending the monkeys in the southern direction, Sugriva said to the cloudlike troop leader called Sushena.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: King (Sugriva) went with folded hands to Tara's father, his fatherinlaw, of terrifying valour, offered salutation and said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva  spoke to the great lustrous monkey Archisman, son of the eminent sage Marichi who possessed the wisdom and prowess of Indra and was comparable to Vaineteya (Garuda) in lustre. He also spoke to the other sons of Maricha, called Marichas, who were very strong and known as Archismalas (garlands of continuous glow) and asked all of them to proceed in the western direction.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva  spoke to the great lustrous monkey Archisman, son of the eminent sage Marichi who possessed the wisdom and prowess of Indra and was comparable to Vaineteya (Garuda) in lustre. He also spoke to the other sons of Maricha, called Marichas, who were very strong and known as Archismalas (garlands of continuous glow) and asked all of them to proceed in the western direction.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O foremost of monkeys with Sushena as your group leader accompanied by two hundred thousand vanaras, go and search for Vaidehi.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O leaders of monkeys search for Sita in the countries of Saurashtra, and also Bahlika, Chandrachitra, in delightful villages and vast towns, also in Kukshi covered haphazardly with punnaga, bakula and uddalaka trees as well as ketaka shrubs.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O leaders of monkeys search for Sita in the countries of Saurashtra, and also Bahlika, Chandrachitra, in delightful villages and vast towns, also in Kukshi covered haphazardly with punnaga, bakula and uddalaka trees as well as ketaka shrubs.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys the auspicious rivers with cool waters flow towards the western region. Search in the groves inhabited by ascetics, other forests, mountains, cliffs, in the desertland. Search in the inaccessible western region surrounded by mountains. Then proceed to the western ocean infested with whales and alligators, which cannot be easily disturbed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys the auspicious rivers with cool waters flow towards the western region. Search in the groves inhabited by ascetics, other forests, mountains, cliffs, in the desertland. Search in the inaccessible western region surrounded by mountains. Then proceed to the western ocean infested with whales and alligators, which cannot be easily disturbed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys the auspicious rivers with cool waters flow towards the western region. Search in the groves inhabited by ascetics, other forests, mountains, cliffs, in the desertland. Search in the inaccessible western region surrounded by mountains. Then proceed to the western ocean infested with whales and alligators, which cannot be easily disturbed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There the monkeys may roam about the Ketaka shrubs, tamala thickets and coconut groves.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look for Sita as well as the residence of Ravana.You should find the whereabouts of Sita in the mountains and forests located on the sea shore. Search in the city of Murachi, beautiful city of Jata, Avanti, Angalopa and in the unnoticed forestland. Look for her in the vast kingdoms and cities all over.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look for Sita as well as the residence of Ravana.You should find the whereabouts of Sita in the mountains and forests located on the sea shore. Search in the city of Murachi, beautiful city of Jata, Avanti, Angalopa and in the unnoticed forestland. Look for her in the vast kingdoms and cities all over.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look for Sita as well as the residence of Ravana.You should find the whereabouts of Sita in the mountains and forests located on the sea shore. Search in the city of Murachi, beautiful city of Jata, Avanti, Angalopa and in the unnoticed forestland. Look for her in the vast kingdoms and cities all over.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There is a lofty mountain with a hundred peaks and great trees at the confluence of river Sindhu and the sea. It is known as Hemagiri (golden mountain).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On the slopes of that mountain you will find lions called Pakshagamas, that is lions with wings. They carry  the whales, fishes and elephants from the sea to their shelters on the beautiful mountain slopes.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The proud elephants wandering on the mountain slopes, and on the vast tract filled with water would be happy trumpeting like thundering clouds. They roam in the caves of lions.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The monkeys capable of assuming any form at their will should search the scraping peaks of the golden mountain (Himagiri) with colourful trees without delay.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys you will see the dazzling golden tip of a mountain called Pariyatra towards the end of the sea. It is extended over a hundred yojanas and  dificult to gaze because of its brilliance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There dwell twentyfour crore of terrific gandharvas blazing like fire who can assume any form.They lead an ascetic life.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Collected together in thousands, and radiating like fire, they live there. Even the very brave vanaras should not go close to them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should not pluck any fruits from those woods, for courageous gandharvas protect the fruits of the trees. It is difficult to go there, for those heroes have frightening bravery.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should not pluck any fruits from those woods, for courageous gandharvas protect the fruits of the trees. It is difficult to go there, for those heroes have frightening bravery.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Exert yourself in your search for Janaki. Indeed there will be no fear from them, if you behave like normal monkeys in a natural way.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: '(Beyond) there  is a glorious mountain called Vajra of the colour of Vaidurya, hard as a diamond with different kinds of trees and vines.The  mountain extends evenly to a stretch of a hundred yojanas.There are caves in the mountain where you may look for her with due effort.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: '(Beyond) there  is a glorious mountain called Vajra of the colour of Vaidurya, hard as a diamond with different kinds of trees and vines.The  mountain extends evenly to a stretch of a hundred yojanas.There are caves in the mountain where you may look for her with due effort.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then move to the fourth part (of the western sea) where you will see  a mountain called Chakravan occupying a quarter part of the sea.You will find there a thousandspiked wheel built by Visvakarma.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It was there that the Supreme Lord Visnu, having slain Hayagriva and Panchajanam,  recovered the discus and conch for himself.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look for Vaidehi and Ravana in the wide caves and colourful slopes of the (Chakravan) mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Plunge deep down into the sea and you will see a goldenpeaked mountain called Varaha, the residence of Varuna.It is extended over sixty four yojanas in the sea.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On the (Varaha) mountain is the city called Pragjyotisha, which is full of gold.There lives the  evilminded demon Naraka.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There all over the wonderful slopes and wide caves look for Vaidehi and Ravana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Possessor of tawny horses, king Indra who killed demon Pakasasana was consecrated by gods at this mountain since known as Meghavan.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On crossing the hill ruled by Indra you will reach the rows of sixty thousand mountains of gold shining like the brilliance of the rising Sun. The mountains glow with golden trees filled with bloom.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On crossing the hill ruled by Indra you will reach the rows of sixty thousand mountains of gold shining like the brilliance of the rising Sun. The mountains glow with golden trees filled with bloom.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In the midst of the sixty thousand hills stands Meru, King of mountains. It is the northern mountain, blessed by the Sungod with a boon in the past.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The Sungod said to mount Meru, 'By my grace all the trees and hillocks of this king of mountains will shine in golden red, the gods, gandharvas and demons who dwell here will have golden radiance '.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The Sungod said to mount Meru, 'By my grace all the trees and hillocks of this king of mountains will shine in golden red, the gods, gandharvas and demons who dwell here will have golden radiance '.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The Visvadevas, Vasus, Maruts, and the gods reach Meru, this great king of mountains, in the evening twilight. Worshipped by them, the Sungod sets behind the mountain and becomes invisible to all beings.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The Visvadevas, Vasus, Maruts, and the gods reach Meru, this great king of mountains, in the evening twilight. Worshipped by them, the Sungod sets behind the mountain and becomes invisible to all beings.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Crossing ten thousand yojanas swiftly in half a moment, the Sun touches the mount behind which he sets.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There is a great divine abode glowing like the Sungod on the peak of the mountain.It is a cluster of mansions built  by Visvakarma.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It is the residence of Varuna, who holds the noose in his hand.It is an enchanting place, full of trees attracting flocks of various birds.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Between mount Asta (the mountain behind which the Sun sets) and Meru there is a shining golden palm tree with ten high peaks and wonderful altars around.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look for Vaidehi and Ravana all over those inaccessible mountains, lakes and rivers.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The sage Merusavarna, knower of dharma, famous for his penance and comparable to Brahma lives there with him on Meru.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Bow down, touch the feet of the seer Merusavarna, who glows like the Sun and then enquire from him about Sita.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The world of living beings is extended to this extent. The Sun dispels darkness at the end of the night and thereafter reaches the mountain behind which he sets (at the end of the day).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O great monkeys you can go only up to that point. The Sun's rays do not extend beyond this and it has no boundaries.We do not know about the area beyond this limit.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Go and find out Sita and the abode of Ravana. After this, return to the mountain behind which the Sun sets and come back on completion of a month.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If you tarry beyond a month, you will be slain. My fatherin law, the brave hero will go with your group.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should obey him. You are meant to carry out his orders. He is not only my fatherinlaw but also a valiant, strong and powerful hero and my preceptor.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'My fatherinlaw will be your leader. His authority will be final in all matters. Accept his authority and look for Vaidehi in the western direction.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 42 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva, the bull among monkeys, having sent his fatherinlaw in the western direction, said to Satavali, troop leader of the monkeys:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Righteous king Sugriva said to the foremost among the monkeys, Satavali what would help his cause as well as the cause of Rama:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Take like you a hundred thousand courageous heroes, your ministers and the sons of Vaivasvata. And begin your expedition.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look all over the northern direction adorned with mighty Himavan as its earring, for the spouse of blameless Rama
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We should be succeessful in our endeavour when we have completed the task dear to Rama. We will be redeemed of our debt to him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Highsouled Rama has done a great service to us earlier. We will be blessed if we are successful in helping Rama in return.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Our life becomes fruitful when we help a person who was not helped us. What to speak of returning the help one has rendered.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Keeping this in mind, you, as my wellwishers, should act in a way Janaki can be traced.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This Rama who can conquer the capitals of enemies is great. He loves and is loved by all living beings including ourselves.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are rich in wisdom and valour. You should search for Sita everywhere including inaccessible forests and mountain ranges.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Search in the countries of Mlechas, Pulindas, Surasenas, Prasthalas, Bharatas, Madrakas, Kurus, Kambojas and even Yavanas, Shakas, Rattakas, Bahlikas, Rishikas, Pauravas, Tankanas, Cheenas, Paramacheenas, Niharas, Daradas and in the Himalaya mountains again and again in order to find her.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Search in the countries of Mlechas, Pulindas, Surasenas, Prasthalas, Bharatas, Madrakas, Kurus, Kambojas and even Yavanas, Shakas, Rattakas, Bahlikas, Rishikas, Pauravas, Tankanas, Cheenas, Paramacheenas, Niharas, Daradas and in the Himalaya mountains again and again in order to find her.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Search in the countries of Mlechas, Pulindas, Surasenas, Prasthalas, Bharatas, Madrakas, Kurus, Kambojas and even Yavanas, Shakas, Rattakas, Bahlikas, Rishikas, Pauravas, Tankanas, Cheenas, Paramacheenas, Niharas, Daradas and in the Himalaya mountains again and again in order to find her.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There you should explore the dwelling of Ravana and Vaidehi, in the thickets of lodhra and lotuses and in the woods of devadaru.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then go and explore the hermitage of Soma inhabited by gods and gandharvas and also the great summits of mount Kala.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look for that great lady, Rama's consort, in the big caves and caverns all over the mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Crossing this lord of hills filled with gold, you should reach the great mountain called Sudarsana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then proceed to mount Devasakha inhabited by a variety of birds adorning the trees.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should search for Ravana as well as Vaidehi everywhere in the thickets of that hill, near the mountain streams and also in caves.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Beyond, there is a desolate place of hundred yojanas with no trace of life, no mountains, no trees, no rivers.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Crossing that horripilating, desolate place quickly, you will be happy to reach the snowy Kailasa mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There is an exquisite mansion of Kubera built by Visvakarma which, embellished with gold, looks like a pale white cloud.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There is a large lotus pond with many lotuses and lilies, inhabited by swans and ducks and frequented by groups of apasaras.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Kubera, son of Vaisravana, a prosperous king of the yakshas (demigods) worshipped by all beings dwells there with Guhyakas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Look for Vaidehi and Ravana all over the caves and mountains of Kilasa of the colour of the moon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Therefrom proceed to mount krauncha mountain and enter carefully its cave which is reportedly difficult to access.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Great ascetics live there. Worshipped even by the gods, these highsouled godlike ascetics shine like the very Sun.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Ransack the peaks of Krauncha, its caves, caverns and ridges.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There is a mountain region known as Kama, and Manasa where there are no trees. It is a bird sanctuary. Not only living beings, even gods, demons and rakshas have no access to that place.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Beyond mount Krauncha you will find Mainaka. All of you should search for Sita in the plain lands and the ridges of the mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There on Mainaka a demon, called Maya has built a mansion all by himself. Try to look in the plain lands, ridges and deep caves of Mainaka and in the residences of kinnera women with faces of horses.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There on Mainaka a demon, called Maya has built a mansion all by himself. Try to look in the plain lands, ridges and deep caves of Mainaka and in the residences of kinnera women with faces of horses.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On passing that place, you will come across a hermitage inhabited by siddhas and ascetics, Vaikhanasas and Valakilyas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'They deserve  your reverence since they are accomplished ascetics.They are cleansed of sins by their penance.You should be polite when you ask them for information  about Sita.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If you cross that region, you will find no Sun, no Moon, no stars, no cloud, no sound.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'That (Sunless) land shines like the radiance of the Sungod with the presence of selfeffulgent ascetics who have attained perfection in penance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Passing that region you will reach a mountain stream called Sailoda. On both the banks of the stream are bamboo groves called Kichakas. They waft the siddhas to and from the river. (Kichakas bend forward forming an arch and thus help sages to cross the river.)
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Thereafter you will reach the country of UttaraKuru, a resort for those who have done meritorious deeds.There are lotus ponds with golden lotuses with bluish and greenish leaves.There are thousands of rivers adorned with red and night lotuses of gold.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Thereafter you will reach the country of UttaraKuru, a resort for those who have done meritorious deeds.There are lotus ponds with golden lotuses with bluish and greenish leaves.There are thousands of rivers adorned with red and night lotuses of gold.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There are tanks and lakes filled with lotuses shining like the rising Sun with lotus leaves having the colour of precious emeralds. The lotus filaments look like golden threads. The entire place is full of blue lotus groves, exquisite pearls and other gems.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There are tanks and lakes filled with lotuses shining like the rising Sun with lotus leaves having the colour of precious emeralds. The lotus filaments look like golden threads. The entire place is full of blue lotus groves, exquisite pearls and other gems.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There the sandy river banks are rich with all kinds of colourful gems resplendent with the brightness of gold. Gold and gems glowing like fire in the best of mountains have entered these rivers.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There the trees are filled with flowers and fruits in all seasons. Birds rest on them.  By their excellent fragrance, taste and smooth feel the fruits and flowers satisfy the desires of all. Some other excellent trees provide barks of various kinds which are used for cloth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There the trees are filled with flowers and fruits in all seasons. Birds rest on them.  By their excellent fragrance, taste and smooth feel the fruits and flowers satisfy the desires of all. Some other excellent trees provide barks of various kinds which are used for cloth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Some other great trees (of the region) provide ornaments suitable for both men and women studded with precious pearls and vaidurya which give pleasure in all seasons.  Other trees put forth beautiful and highly valuable ornaments.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Some other great trees (of the region) provide ornaments suitable for both men and women studded with precious pearls and vaidurya which give pleasure in all seasons.  Other trees put forth beautiful and highly valuable ornaments.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The trees of that region deliver beds with colourful spreads. Some trees yield garlands of flowers pleasing to the heart.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Some trees bring forth many  good quality drinks, eatables and also virtuous  women, young and beautiful.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There gandharvas, kinneras, siddhas, nagas and vidyadharas, radiant like the Sun, are seen sporting with their female companions.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'By virtue of their meritorious deeds (done in the previous birth) they live a luxurious life of riches and sensual pleasures with their female partners.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Pleasing sounds of heavenly musicvocal and instrumental and laughter of celestial beings are ever heard in that region.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There nobody is unhappy or inclined towards evil deeds and virtues in people go increasing day by day.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Cross it and, you will reach the northern sea. In its midst is the great golden mountain, Somagiri.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Only those who have reached the world of Indra and Brahma in heaven can see that  king of mountains.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'That place gets light and heat even though there is no Sun.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Even divine beings, the elevenfold Samhbu, the allpervading Visnu and Lord Brahma surrounded by Brahmarshis (divine seers) reside there.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should not go beyond the north of Kuru. No living being can trespass it.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It is difficult even for gods to reach Somagiri. You should return immediately after seeing that mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkey leaders it is not possible for monkeys to go beyond. The Sun does not shine beyond that place and it is not visible. We do not know what lies beyond that (Somagiri).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should keep in mind the places described. You may also think of other places I might have omitted.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O heroic monkeys comparable to fire If you are successful in finding Vaidehi you will be carrying out your duty.  Rama will be highly pleased by your action. My pleasure will be even greater.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys, when you have accomplished your goal, you will be honoured by me as though you have returned after scoring a victory over the enemy. You will roam this earth with your relatives, rejoicing in the company of your loved ones. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends of fortythird sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 43 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva mentioned about the capacity of Hanuman, the best of monkeys as he knew he would surely succeed in accomplishing the task.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva, king of the monkeys, spoke, highly pleased, to Hanuman, the warrior son of the Windgod advancing towards him:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O best of monkeys I scarcely see a hero comparable to your speed on earth or in space or sky or heaven or water.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O hero, O great monkey in movement, speed, brilliance and quickness you are similar to your mighty father, the Windgod.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I do not know any living being equal to you in brilliance on this earth. Therefore, you alone know how to secure Sita.Go ahead
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O learned Hanuman I am of opinion that in you alone rest strength, wisdom, prowess, ability to act in accordance with time and place and knowledge of statecraft'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having understood that Hanuman was capable of accomplishing the goal, Rama started reflecting as follows:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'This  monkey  king, Sugriva has confidence in Hanuman that he will by all means accomplish the task.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The king Sugriva knows for sure that if Hanuman goes forth, success is assured. So he favours him.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mighty Rama was happy in his heart to see Hanuman. He felt as if the task is achieved.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama, scorcher of enemies, gladly gave Hanuman a ring inscribed with his name as a mark of identification by princess (Sita). And said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O distinguished monkey Janaka's daughter will greet you without any hesitation when you present this signet to her. She will know that you have come from me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O great hero your enterprise,  prowess coupled with courage and Sugriva's message to you seem to indicate to me about the success of your mission'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The foremost among the monkeys took the ring given to him, placed it on his forehead and saluated it with folded palms. He then prostrated at the feet of Rama and departed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Like the moon adorned by hosts of stars in the cloudless sky, the mighty heroic Hanuman, the great son of the Windgod, shone in the midst of the army of monkeys.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: O Hanuman son of the Windgod, O valiant among the Vanaras, I bank on your strength. Do whatever you can with your mighty valour so that the daughter of Janaka can be found. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 44 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Summoning the entire body of vanaras, Sugriva, the bull among monkeys, said, 'Go to the places I have described and look for  Sita in order to fulfil Rama's objective'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having understood Sugriva's strict orders, the forces of monkeys started moving. They spread like locusts all over the earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Rama accompanied by Lakshmana stayed back at Prasravana mountain looking forward for the expiry of the month fixed for the monkeys to trace Sita's whereabouts.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the monkey warrior Satavali departed for the north, surrounded by kings of mountains.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vinata, leader of the monkeys, set out for the eastern direction.The troop leader,  son of the Windgod along with Angada and Tara left for the south inhabited by Agastya.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vinata, leader of the monkeys, set out for the eastern direction.The troop leader,  son of the Windgod along with Angada and Tara left for the south inhabited by Agastya.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The chieftain Sushena, tiger among the monkeys, started quickly for the fearsome western direction ruled by Varuna.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sugriva, chief of the army of monkeys, having sent the leaders to all quarters felt relieved and rejoiced.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Addressed thus  by the king, all the monkeys departed quickly from there for their respective directions with all enthusiasm.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The powerful monkeys went gallopping and chattering, leaping and screaming.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thus addressed by the king, the leaders of the monkeys shouted, 'We will kill Ravana and get back Sita'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I shall kill Ravana singlehanded in war and quickly get back Janaka's daughter churning (the enemy army).' (said one)
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I will alone restore Sita, exhausted and trembling (in fear), even from the nether world. Wait here' (said another leader).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I will smash trees, shatter mountains, cleave the earth and churn up the seas'. (said a another).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I can doubtless cross a distance of a hundred yojanas' said one. Another said,' I can leap a hundred yojanas more'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 45 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When the chieftains of the monkeys left, Rama enquired Sugriva, how he had come to know  the regions of the entire earth (which is a mandala. a circular form).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then offering reverential salutation to Rama, Sugriva said, 'I shall narrate in detail. Listen, O bull among men
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vali chased the demon Dundubhi in buffalo form into a cave of mount Malaya in order to kill him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Vali chased the demon Dundubhi in buffalo form into a cave of mount Malaya in order to kill him.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then I waited at the entrance of the cave with due loyalty. A year passed. Yet Vali did not return.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There seeing the cave overflowing with the gushing blood, I was bewildered, thinking that my brother might have been killed. I suffered intense agony.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Thereafter, convinced that my brother was killed, I placed a mountainsize rock at the entrance of the cave so that Dundubhi will be destroyed, unable to come out of the cave.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I lost hope of his life and came back to Kishkinda. Having got the kingdom, and also Ruma and Tara, I was anointed king and ruled it fearlessly with all friends.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I lost hope of his life and came back to Kishkinda. Having got the kingdom, and also Ruma and Tara, I was anointed king and ruled it fearlessly with all friends.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The evilminded Vali, having lost his selfcontrol, ran after me in anger, to kill me and my ministers. I kept running.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then I ran in the eastern direction and saw many trees, lakes, rivers and beautiful mountains.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There I saw, filled with minerals the mountain behind which the Sun rises and the milky ocean frequented by the apsaras.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king chased thus by Vali, I ran and turned back and ran againfast.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then chased by Vali, I changed my present direction from the east towards the southern quarter where Vindhya mountain stood with its, beautiful sandal trees.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I was looking at the trees and mountains in the southern direction, I reached the western quarter pursued by Vali.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Looking at the places around, I reached the best of mountains where the Sun sets (I found Vali still chasing me) and ran towards the north.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I saw Himavan and mount Meru on the north and the northern sea. Still pursued by Vali, I could not know where to go when wise Hanuman spoke to me these words:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I remembed Matanga's curse to Vali, king of monkeys. Vali would not enter the site of Matanga's hermitage as his head would break into a hundred pieces if he did'. Therefore  we thought it would be safe for us to reside in that place.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I remembed Matanga's curse to Vali, king of monkeys. Vali would not enter the site of Matanga's hermitage as his head would break into a hundred pieces if he did'. Therefore  we thought it would be safe for us to reside in that place.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O prince Rama then I reached mount Rishyamuka which Vali did not enter out of fear of the curse of Matanga.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king that way I surveyed the entire earth directly and returned to this cave and lived here. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षटचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortysixth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 46 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The leaders of vanara troops went fast in all directions to look for Vaidehi following the instructions of  the king of vanaras.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They went looking everywhere in the tanks, in the bottom of rivers, in towns, in the sky and similarly in inaccessible rivers, mountains, and forts surrounded by rivers.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The troop leaders of the monkeys instructed by Sugriva searched in all places including mountains and forests.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkeys used to search for Sita all day determinedly and at night assemble at one place.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkeys would search all day and by night reach for rest the branches of the trees that bear fruits in all seasons.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkey leaders thus spent a month doing what they did daily and returning disappointed, met the monkey king on mount Prasravana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having searched for Sita as instructed by  Sugriva, powerful Vinita returned along with the ministers unable to find Sita.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the great monkey hero Satabali came back from the northern direction along with the army after searching in vain for Sita.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sushena searched for a full month in the western quarter along with the monkeys and returned to report to Sugriva.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sushena came to Sugriva, seated with Rama at Prasravana mountain, offered salutations and spoke:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We searched for her in the mountains, in inaccessible forests, in rivers and seas and also the countryside.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We searched for her in the caves, in places filled with extensive vines and huge bushes and in all places mentioned by you.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We searched again and again the interior, inaccessible and uneven locations,and killed huge animals. We searched in regions difficult to penetrate.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O king of monkeys we hope, his exhalted highness, the mighty vanara, son of the Windgod, Hanuman has gone in the direction in which Maithili has been carried off. He alone will find Sita and come back.' इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 47 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman, the monkey accompanied by Tara and Angada proceeded as instructed by Sugriva in the (South) direction.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He went a long distance with other heroic monkeys, searching in the impenetrable caves of Vindhya mountain. They combed interior places, mountain peaks, fortresses surrounded by rivers, lakes, extensive groves of trees, bushes and thickets.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He went a long distance with other heroic monkeys, searching in the impenetrable caves of Vindhya mountain. They combed interior places, mountain peaks, fortresses surrounded by rivers, lakes, extensive groves of trees, bushes and thickets.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The heroic monkeys went searching all over the direction for the daughter of Janaka, but in vain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The unassailable monkeys ate roots and fruits and halted here and there at different places searching for Sita.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They searched in dense forests, interior locations impassable, desolate and terrific, without water, and people.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having searched all over in the forests and very difficult areas, the fearless, invincible vanaras moved forward, leaving that place and entered another areasearching.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As they marched forward, they entered a location where there were trees devoid of leaves, flowers and fruits and rivers without water and a place where it was difficult to get roots (for food).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There were no buffaloes, no deer, no elephants, tigers or even  birds and  other wild animals.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There were no medicinal plants, no vines or creepers spreading on the ground.The lotus creepers on the dry ground had shining leaves,beautiful and fragrant blooms devoid of bees.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There were no medicinal plants, no vines or creepers spreading on the ground.The lotus creepers on the dry ground had shining leaves,beautiful and fragrant blooms devoid of bees.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: There was a sage called Kandu who was truthful, outrageous and shorttempered. He observed strict austerities and was rich in penance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The great sage was enraged because he had lost his sixteenyearold son in the forest.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Cursed by the great righteous sage the entire forest turned barren, unfit to harbour  living beings and became devoid of even beasts and birds.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkeys searched in the forest regions, in the mountains, rivers and sources of rivers with concentrated attention.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Eager to please Sugriva, the great souls searched  in the forest region. Even there they   could not find Janaka's daughter and also Ravana who had abducted Sita.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: (Then) they noticed a place covered with creepers and bushes. As soon as they entered the dreadful forest, they saw a demon of wicked deeds, unafraid even of gods.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkeys beheld the dreadful demon standing firmly like a huge, incomparable mountain in front of them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Seeing the monkeys, the infuriated demon ran towards them, raising his fist firmly, saying, 'You are all as good as dead, now that I have caught you.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Mistaking him for Ravana, Angada, Vali's son at once pounced on him and slapped him with his palm.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Struck by Vali's son, the demon vomitting blood from the mouth, fell down on the ground like a mountain, uprooted.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He breathed his last, and the monkeys who won went searching almost all over the mountain caves.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Again they searched the forest and  entered another dreadful mountain cave.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 48 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Wise Angada, exhausted after the search, collected the monkeys, and consoling them, said slowly:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We have searched here, there, everywhere, in dense forests, hills, forts, impenetrable caverns and mountain ranges. But we could find neither Janaki who is like a goddess nor the demon who abducted her.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We have searched here, there, everywhere, in dense forests, hills, forts, impenetrable caverns and mountain ranges. But we could find neither Janaki who is like a goddess nor the demon who abducted her.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You should keep searching on till we see Sita, Janaka's daughter, giving up laziness and sorrow and sleep that is overpowering us.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It is said, zeal, capability, and fortitude can overcome defeat and lead to success. Therefore I am saying this.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Search this impenetrable forest even now, O you denizens of this forest Give up grief, let us all once again ransack this forest.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Sugriva, the monkey king, is wrathful and awards severe punishment. We should ever bear in mind the (purpose of the) great self, Rama.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I have said all this for your good. You may carry it out, if it pleases you. Speak freely if there is any other course left for all of us, O monkeys'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having heard Angada, Gandhamadana worn out by thirst and exhaustion, replied in a feeble tone:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'What Angada says is appropriate, beneficial and also favourable. Carry out his command.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Once again let us explore the mountains, caverns, forests, desolate places and mountain streams.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Once again the  monkeys rose up and started exploring the mountain ranges of Vindhya and the forests surrounding the southern side.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Eager to find Sita, the best of monkeys climbed the silver mountain rich with peaks and caverns resembling the autumnal clouds. And looked out into the Lodhra grove and the garden of seven leaves (banara plantations).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Eager to find Sita, the best of monkeys climbed the silver mountain rich with peaks and caverns resembling the autumnal clouds. And looked out into the Lodhra grove and the garden of seven leaves (banara plantations).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even after scaling up the peak, the exhausted, heroic monkeys could not find Vaidehi, the dear queen of Rama.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having looked all over the mountain and many caverns, those monkeys got down from the mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Descending to the foothills, the exhausted monkeys became quiet. Fatigued and disheartened, they assembled under a tree, stood for a moment and then lay down.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Resting for a while, the frustrated monkeys resumed their search throughout the southern direction.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The bulls among vanaras and Hanuman, the chief of the group again started exploring  everywhere in the Vindhya range starting from the beginning. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fortyninth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 49 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman, together with the monkeys, Tara and Angada, searched in the impenetrable places and caves of Vindhya.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They also searched near rivers, mountain streams, hill ranges, caves of lions and tigers, in the rock shelters and difficult spots of vast mountains.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: They reached the end of the southwest side of the mountain(Vindhya). While they were still there, the time stipulated for them (to find Sita) had slipped.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The son of the Windgod, Hanuman, searched all over the mountains and caves and woods difficult to access in that southwestern region of the mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having explored the region surrounded by a network of mountains, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda and also Dvivida, Sushena, Jambavan, Angada the heir apparent, Tara the forestdweller staying close to one another and Hanuman too not far from the others searched in the southern direction. While  they were exploring, they saw the mouth of a large cave called Rikshabilam, which had its mouth open,  guarded by a demon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having explored the region surrounded by a network of mountains, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda and also Dvivida, Sushena, Jambavan, Angada the heir apparent, Tara the forestdweller staying close to one another and Hanuman too not far from the others searched in the southern direction. While  they were exploring, they saw the mouth of a large cave called Rikshabilam, which had its mouth open,  guarded by a demon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having explored the region surrounded by a network of mountains, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda and also Dvivida, Sushena, Jambavan, Angada the heir apparent, Tara the forestdweller staying close to one another and Hanuman too not far from the others searched in the southern direction. While  they were exploring, they saw the mouth of a large cave called Rikshabilam, which had its mouth open,  guarded by a demon.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Overcome with hunger and thirst, the exhausted monkeys noticed a huge cave covered with creepers and bushes, while they were looking around for water.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 50 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
