She was crying, loudly calling out the names of Rama and Lakshmana, her hair dishevelled.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I was greeted by the most illustrious siddhas. I came to know from them that he was Ravana, the king of demons. I was looking at him while he was abducting Janaka's daughter, who was the wife of Dasaratha's Rama. Her ornaments had dropped and silken robes had slipped since she lost hold on herself. She was crying, loudly calling out the names of Rama and Lakshmana, her hair dishevelled.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O father this is the cause of my delay', said Suparshva, who knew the value of time.                 Thus he gave the entire account to me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Even after hearing this I could not advance (against Ravana). How could I, a vulture without wings, leap even a little?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Being endowed with the faculty of thinking and speech I shall tell you what is possible for you to execute with your prowess. Listen.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I will please you with my word and thought and do not doubt that Rama's task is dear to me as well.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Indeed, you monkeys are very wise, strong and sensitive. The king of monkeys has sent you on this mission. You cannot be conquered even by gods.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The heronfeathered arrows of Rama and Lakshmana are sharp and strong enough to protect or subdue all the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The tenheaded Ravana is mighty, powerful and strong, indeed. But you are efficient and it will not be difficult for you to achieve this task.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Do not bother about the time limit. Resolve to achieve the objective, for wise people  like you should not lag behind in accepting challenges.' इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 59 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sampati bathed and offered libations to Jatayu. Then all the monkeys sat round him on the beautiful mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Angada sat near Sampati surrounded by all monkeys. Sampati who had gained confidence spoke to Angada  once again joyously.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys I shall tell you in detail how I came to know the princess from Mithila. Listen quietly with rapt attention:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Scorched by the rays of the Sun, I was burnt totally and fell on the peak of this mount Vindhya years ago.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then I looked at the oceans, the mountains, rivers, lakes, forests and all locations and  my memory returned gradually.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I came to know then that this place is inhabited by flocks of happy birds and full of many caves and mountain peaks. This is mount Vindhya on the shore of the southern ocean.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'There was a hermitage nearby, where a revered sage, who was even worshpped by gods  lived. His name was Nishakara. He did rigorous penance here.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O righteous monkeys after the death of sage Nishakara eight thousand years have passed. And I have been living here.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I descended down slowly from the high rugged peak of the Vindhya mountain with great difficulty to the plain land bristling with sharp, harsh darbha grass.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Eager to see the great sage I reached the place with much difficulty. I and my brother Jatayu had  approached him many a time earlier.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In the vicinity of that hermitage there was no tree without flowers or fruits and fragrant was the breeze that blew around.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On reaching the sacred hermitage, I stood and waited under a tree for the audience of the divine sage Nishakara.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'He was followed by bears, deer, tigers, lions, elephants and snakes just as living beings follow their creator.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Just as the army including feudatories recede, when the king comes, all those creatures repaired to their dens when they knew the arrival of the sage at the hermitage.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The sage who entered the hermitage came out again within a moment on seeing me and enquired about me affectionately:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O gentle one seeing your body devoid of hair I can understood that your wings have been burnt and your body bruised.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are the king among vultures equal to wind in speed.I had seen both the brothers earlier and both of you could change your form at will.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'What disease has affected you? Why are your wings dropped down? Who punished you in this way? Tell me.' इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtieth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 60 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then I revealed everything to the sage,including the arrogant, impetuous action of rashly following the Sun (for challenging Indra).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O revered sage I am exhausted and my senses are depressed. I am ashamed of myself. My body is wounded. Therefore I am not able to reply.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Deluded by pride, I and my brother Jatayu challenging each other to test our relative strength flew  far into the sky.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Both of us made a bet on the peak of mount Kailasa in the presence of sages to follow the Sungod until he sets on the western mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'And from there both of us looked at all the cities on the land which seemed like the size of chariot wheels one after the other.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We heard at some places sounds of musical instruments, sounds of Vedic chanting, and many lovely young women dressed in redsinging.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'We flew quickly into the sky and reached the path of the Sun and looked down at the forest which looked like a green lawn.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The earth filled with lofty mountains appeared as if it is covered with pebbles. Surrounded by rivers meandering, it looked as though it was entwined with threads.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The mountains of the earth, Himavan and Vindhya and the great Meru looked like huge elephants in a huge pond.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Much sweat, pain and fear generated in us while we went on and up. This led to terrific confusion and stupor.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I did not know which the southern direction was or the southeast or the west. It looked as if the world had been consumed by fire and dissolved, as if it was the end of the yuga.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'My mind was disturbed and I turned my attention from the object. Once again I focused my attention (on the Sun) and could see the Sungod with great effort. The Sun appeared to us equal in size to earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'My mind was disturbed and I turned my attention from the object. Once again I focused my attention (on the Sun) and could see the Sungod with great effort. The Sun appeared to us equal in size to earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Without taking leave of me Jatayu descended down to the earth. Seeing that, I also followed him down quickly from the sky.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I protected Jatayu with my wings so that he was not burnt. I, however, got burnt miserably and fell down from the aerial region.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I thought Jatayu had fallen down somewhere at Janasthana, but I fell on Vindhya, wings burnt, in an unconscious state.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Bereft of my kingdom, my brother and my wings, and having lost my strength I desire to fall down from the mountain top and die.' इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtyfirst sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 61 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'When thus I spoke to the venerable sage in that manner roaring very painfully the divine sage replied after reflecting silently for a moment:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You will get new wings and feathers and also other parts.You will attain vision, life, prowess and strength.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I have foreseen with the power of my penance that a great task will be done by you. I have also heard about it in the Puranas and came to know of it.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Indeed in the Ikshvaku family there will be a king named Dasaratha. He will beget a brilliant son named Rama.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On account of the command of his father, Rama armed with the strength of truth will proceed to the forest with his brother Lakshmana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The king of demons, Ravana who is indestructible even by gods and demons will be abducting his wife from Janastahana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Immersed in grief, chaste and famed Sita, will not take any food or enjoy pleasures however much she is tempted.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Knowing that Vaidehi is not eating food(given by Ravana) Indra,the ruler of gods, will offer nectarlike food rare even for gods.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having understood that it has been provided by Indra, Sita will take out a large portion of it and pour it on the ground (as an offering to Rama) and say 'I offer it to Rama wherever he is on earth'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If my husband and Lakshmana are living or else even if they have attained heaven let this food be enjoyed by them', Sita will say.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Rama's messenger and other monkeys will be coming to search for the his queen. O Sampati you should narrate this to them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'It is good for you in all respects to remain here. Where can you go (without wings)? Wait for appropriate time and place. You will recover your wings'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am not enthusiastic about giving you the wings now. Remain here and carry on the work for the welfare of the world.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: '(Carry on) the work not only for the princes (Rama and Lakshmana) but also for the brahmins, sages, gods and others who live here.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I also want to see Rama and Lakshmana. But I do not like to hold on to my life for long. Hence I will give up my body'. The knower of self, the sage (Nishakara) said this to Sampati. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे  द्विषष्टितम स्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 62 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The sage who was skilful in speech, having  praised me thus and in many other ways,  permitted me to leave and entered his dwelling.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having crawled slowly and slowly from the cave and climbed the Vindhya, I have been awaiting your arrival.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'More than a hundred years have passed and all this time I have borne the sage's words in my heart and have waited for the right time and place.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Nishakara went on his last journey and attained heaven. Since then many sad thoughts have crisscrossed my mind and I am consumed with those thoughts.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Whenever I intended to die, the words of the sage rang in my mind. The inspiration he gave me to preserve my life removed my agony like the glowing flames of fire that take away darkness.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I goaded my son with harsh words saying, 'Knowing the valour of the evilminded Ravana, why did you not protect her (Sita)'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Even after hearing the wailing of Sita, knowing that both (Rama and Lakshmana) are separated from her and considering my friendship with Dasaratha, I felt displeased with my son (as he did not make an attempt to rescue her)'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Even as he was telling this to the monkeys his wings started appearing in their presence.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: He experienced an unparalleled delight seeing wings with red feathers growing on his body, and said to the monkeys:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'By the grace of the most revered soul,sage Nishakara, both my wings that were burnt by the Sun's radiance have grown again.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The valour, strength and even courage that I had in my youth,I am experiencing now.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Sampati, the foremost of the birds thus spoke to the monkeys and flew up from the mountain's peak keen on finding the aerial path.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The tigers among monkeys felt very happy on hearing the words of Sampati and became sure of their success with their valour.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkeys as strong as the wind regained courage and went in search of the daughter of Janaka in the direction of Abhijit (constellation known as Abhijit is associated with success). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtythird sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 63 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hearing the words spoken by the king of vultures, the highly courageous monkeys assembled together and leaped with joyscreaming.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On hearing the words of Sampati, the monkeys felt glad and, eager to see Sita, reached the ocean, the passage to the abode of Ravana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Having reached the ocean, the monkeys, endowed with frightening courage, stood looking at the vast ocean which appeared like an image of the whole world.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Powerful and heroic monkeys assembled at the northern end of the southern ocean.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The ocean was of terrifying form filled with various violent species of grotesque creatures of huge bodies playing in the water. Full of violent tides, it appeared asleep at one place and apparently sporting in another. In some places it was rising as high as a mountain with huge volumes of water. It was as if roaring with the demon chiefs residing in the underworld. The great monkeys were worried seeing the huge ocean which created horripilation in them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The ocean was of terrifying form filled with various violent species of grotesque creatures of huge bodies playing in the water. Full of violent tides, it appeared asleep at one place and apparently sporting in another. In some places it was rising as high as a mountain with huge volumes of water. It was as if roaring with the demon chiefs residing in the underworld. The great monkeys were worried seeing the huge ocean which created horripilation in them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The ocean was of terrifying form filled with various violent species of grotesque creatures of huge bodies playing in the water. Full of violent tides, it appeared asleep at one place and apparently sporting in another. In some places it was rising as high as a mountain with huge volumes of water. It was as if roaring with the demon chiefs residing in the underworld. The great monkeys were worried seeing the huge ocean which created horripilation in them.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: All the monkeys were worried when they suddenly saw the ocean which looked impassable like the sky. They wondered if they can at all accomplish the task (of finding Sita)
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Angada, the best among the monkeys saw the worried army despondent gazing at the ocean, and comforted the frightened troops.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Angada,the strong and wise  son of Vali, spoke thus to the tensed vanaras in the right time:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Do not be despondent. It is the biggest flaw. It destroys a person like an angry serpent killing a young child.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If one succumbs to despondency while he has to exhibit his valour, his brilliance gets diminished and he does not succeed in his manly pursuits'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: With the night over, Angada joined the older monkeys again and sought their counsel.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The army of monkeys encircled Angada like the army of Maruts surrounding Indra.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Who else other than the son of Vali and Hanuman can resist and pacify the monkeyarmy?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the illustrious Angada, subduer of foes took the counsel of elderly monkeys and  the army into confidence and thus addressed them all in meaningful words:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Now which mighty monkey will cross the ocean? Who will prove Sugriva, subduer of enemies, true to his promise?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys which one can leap a hundred yojanas and liberate the monkey leaders from the great fear of Sugriva?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'By whose effort can we be successful and return home happily from here to meet wives and sons?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'By whose grace shall we approach Rama and Lakshmana and even the monkey king Sugriva happily?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If there is any one among you who is capable of leaping  across the ocean he will be giving all of us the sacred gift of life quickly?'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: After hearing Angada, no one spoke a word. The entire army of monkeys became still and motionless.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Angada, the best of the monkeys again addressed them saying, 'you are all mighty, eminent and courageous, born in renowned families and have been honoured again and again(for your actions).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'None of you at any time have faced any obstruction in doing your deeds. You are efficient  in leaping. O bulls among monkeys now speak out, who among you can fly and how far? इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 64 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter, on hearing Angada, all the leaders among the monkeys, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda, Dvivida, Sushena and Jambavan as well expressed one after  the other their capability for leaping.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Thereafter, on hearing Angada, all the leaders among the monkeys, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda, Dvivida, Sushena and Jambavan as well expressed one after  the other their capability for leaping.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Gaja said he can leap ten yojanas and Gavaksha said he can go upto twenty yojanas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Gavaya said to the monkeys 'I can leap thirty yojanas Sarabha said 'I can leap forty yojanas' bright Ghandhamadana said 'I can leap as far as fifty yojanas without any doubt' Mainda said 'I can leap more than sixty yojanas' highly brilliant Dvivida said in turn, 'I can no doubt leap seventy yojanas ' brilliant and best of the monkeys Sushena declared 'I can leap across eighty yojanas'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Gavaya said to the monkeys 'I can leap thirty yojanas Sarabha said 'I can leap forty yojanas' bright Ghandhamadana said 'I can leap as far as fifty yojanas without any doubt' Mainda said 'I can leap more than sixty yojanas' highly brilliant Dvivida said in turn, 'I can no doubt leap seventy yojanas ' brilliant and best of the monkeys Sushena declared 'I can leap across eighty yojanas'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Gavaya said to the monkeys 'I can leap thirty yojanas Sarabha said 'I can leap forty yojanas' bright Ghandhamadana said 'I can leap as far as fifty yojanas without any doubt' Mainda said 'I can leap more than sixty yojanas' highly brilliant Dvivida said in turn, 'I can no doubt leap seventy yojanas ' brilliant and best of the monkeys Sushena declared 'I can leap across eighty yojanas'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Gavaya said to the monkeys 'I can leap thirty yojanas Sarabha said 'I can leap forty yojanas' bright Ghandhamadana said 'I can leap as far as fifty yojanas without any doubt' Mainda said 'I can leap more than sixty yojanas' highly brilliant Dvivida said in turn, 'I can no doubt leap seventy yojanas ' brilliant and best of the monkeys Sushena declared 'I can leap across eighty yojanas'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Gavaya said to the monkeys 'I can leap thirty yojanas Sarabha said 'I can leap forty yojanas' bright Ghandhamadana said 'I can leap as far as fifty yojanas without any doubt' Mainda said 'I can leap more than sixty yojanas' highly brilliant Dvivida said in turn, 'I can no doubt leap seventy yojanas ' brilliant and best of the monkeys Sushena declared 'I can leap across eighty yojanas'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Gavaya said to the monkeys 'I can leap thirty yojanas Sarabha said 'I can leap forty yojanas' bright Ghandhamadana said 'I can leap as far as fifty yojanas without any doubt' Mainda said 'I can leap more than sixty yojanas' highly brilliant Dvivida said in turn, 'I can no doubt leap seventy yojanas ' brilliant and best of the monkeys Sushena declared 'I can leap across eighty yojanas'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: When the monkeys were talking (of their individual capacity) in that manner about their speed, Jambavan the oldest of the monkeys inferred (their capacity) and said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Earlier I was also very courageous, but now I have become old and reached the fag end of life.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'However  in this situation, it is not possible for us to neglect (our task) as it is the order of the monkeyking and Rama who are determined to achieve the objective.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Jambavan, the distinguished among the monkeys again said, 'My strength to leap into the sky was not only that much (I was stronger in my youth and could cover longer distances)'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In the past, at the time of the wellknown yagna (of king Bali) I was very strong. I circumambulated the eternal Vishnu while he was taking three strides (in his incarnation of Trivikrama Vamana.)
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Having grown old I do not have the same courage. In my youth my prowess was incomparable and none could excel me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I guess that at this time I do not have the capacity to fly to that extent. Achieving the objective is out of question with this much of energy.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then the wise Angada said to great Jambavan, in a gentle manner about his  own strength.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I can  certainly go to a distance of a hundred yojanas. However, I cannot say whether I will have enough capacity to return?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Jambavan who was skilful in speech spoke to that great Angada, 'O leader among monkeys and bears your energy to cover this distance is wellknown to us'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You can go upto even a hundred thousand yojanas and have the required energy to return also. But it is not proper to send you (because you are the heir apparent).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O scorcher of enemies, you are established as the commander of the army and it is proper for us to protect you as we protect our wives.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O subduer of enemies in acomplishing this task you are the root. O dear therefore you should always be taken care of by us just like the wife looked after.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The root of any objective should be protected well. This is the basis of an accomplisher. Only when the roots are intact, the trees have the ability to yield flowers and fruits.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O warrior of proven valour O subduer of enemies in achieving this objective you are the source, being endowed with valour and wisdom.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O best of monkeys you are the son of my guide (Vali) and respectable. We will be capable of accomplishing the goal only under your protection and guidance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Jambavan, the wise monkey having said that, Angada, the great son of Vali, replied:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If I do not go and no other monkey leader goes, then we have to resort to fasting unto death once again.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If I do not fulfil the objective of the wise king of monkeys I cannot save my life even after returning there (Kishkinda).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The monkey king has the authority to shower grace or give vent to his anger. If we go without fulfilling the task we will face destruction.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Therefore, think over well so that we do not fail ultimately. You have a vision.You should suggest means by which this mission does not misfire.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On listening to Angada's words, Jambavan, the  bull among monkeys, replied this way:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O hero this work will not be balked. I will now inspire one who can achieve this task.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 65 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then Jambavan observed the worries of several hundred thousands of the monkey army and said to Hanuman:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Hanuman you are the choicest one among many scholars wellversed in all sastras. Why do you sit alone? Why do you not speak?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Hanuman you are equal to the king of monkeys and also Rama and Lakshmana in brilliance and strength.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are the son of Arishtanemi (sage Kasyapa) and Vinata, and your gurulike (elder brother) is Garuda, the greatest among birds. He is powerful and and famous.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Garuda is very powerful, swift, and famous. I have seen him snatching serpents from the ocean many times.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The strength of your shoulders is equal to that of his (Garuda's) wings. Your speed and valour are no less.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O leader of the monkeys you are superior in strength, wisdom, brilliance and valour to all beings. Why do you not realise your own strength?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O dear she was famous in the three worlds, peerless in beauty and could change form at her free will. She was born of a monkey on this land by dint of a curse.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'She was the daughter of a great king of monkeys called Kunjara. That young and beautiful lady had assumed a lustrous human form decked with wonderful garlands, ornaments and silk clothes and was roving on top of the mountain which appeared like a proud raincloud.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'She was the daughter of a great king of monkeys called Kunjara. That young and beautiful lady had assumed a lustrous human form decked with wonderful garlands, ornaments and silk clothes and was roving on top of the mountain which appeared like a proud raincloud.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'While the largeeyed lady was stationed on the mountain top, the Windgod gently let her auspicious yellow garment with red border fly away.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then he (Windgod) saw her curved, wellset thighs, her beautiful plump breasts and her lovely pleasing face.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On seeing the broad hips, slender waist and beautiful limbs of that famous lady the Windgod was infatuated.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The Windgod lost his control over himself. His whole being was overpowered by love for her beautiful, flawless body. He embraced her with his long arms.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'She was bewildered by this and being chaste and strict observer of chastiny she said, 'Who is it that has destroyed my monoandry?
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On hearing Anjana's words, the Windgod replied, ' O auspicious lady, I do you no harm, O lady of beautiful hips. I reached (enjoyed) you in mind, not body. You need not fear.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O renowned lady I have embraced you and united with you mentally (enjoyed you without physical contact).You will bring forth a son endowed with great wisdom and courage.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'He will be very powerful, illustrious and will be of great valour and strength. He will be my equal in leaping and flying'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O great monkey O strongshouldered one having been assured that way, your mother was pleased and delivered you, a bull among monkeys, in a cave.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'On seeing the rising Sun in the deep forest, mistaking him to be a fruit, you wanted to seize it, when you were young.You suddenly flew into the sky and went flying towards the Sun.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O great monkey you went three hundred yojanas and were pushed back by the  Sun's radiance. Yet it did not leave you depressed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O great monkey while falling fast in space, wise Indra hurled his thunderbolt quickly at you, in anger.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You fell on the edge of the mountain peak and your left chin  got broken. Since then you are widely known as Hanuman (one who has a wounded chin).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The Windgod who is a carrier of fragrance and breaker of trees became very angry on seeing (the injury on) you and stopped blowing in the three worlds.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O dear when the Windgod was pleased, Brahma gave a boon to you, to appease his anger. The boon made you truly valiant so that you cannot be struck by any weapon and killed.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O lord observing that you are not hurt even when struck by the thunderbolt, Indra offered, one of the best boons to you, to choose to die only when you wish.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are a son of Kesari endowed with terrific strength and a lawful son of Maruta also. You are, therefore, equal to the very Windgod in flying and in brilliance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'You are a son of Kesari endowed with terrific strength and a lawful son of Maruta also. You are, therefore, equal to the very Windgod in flying and in brilliance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Now we have almost lost our life.You are our saviour like another monkeyking (like Garuda, king of birds).You are fully endowed with valour and courage.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O dear when Visnu (Vamana incarnate) took three strides I circumambulated the whole earth including its mountains and trees twentyone times.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Then on receiving orders from the gods, we collected medicinal herbs and nectar which gave us great strength.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I have become old and my valour is depleted. At this time you are the sole resort for us. You have all the necessary qualities.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Cheer up and advance.You are the best among the creatures that can leap.The entire army of monkeys want to see your valour.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Hanuman, tiger among monkeys, rise up and cross this great ocean.You have that supreme capacity among all beings.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O Hanuman All the monkeys look dejected. Why do you delay? O warrior, act quick with your rapid speed like Trivikrama who took three strides that covered the entire universe'.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 66 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In order to cross a hundred yojanas, Hanuman, the best of monkeys expanded his  might and strength. Seeing him, a warrior of great strength, all the monkeys, filled with enthusiasm at once gave up grief and collected together.They rejoiced and propitiated him screaming aloud.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'In order to cross a hundred yojanas, Hanuman, the best of monkeys expanded his  might and strength. Seeing him, a warrior of great strength, all the monkeys, filled with enthusiasm at once gave up grief and collected together.They rejoiced and propitiated him screaming aloud.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkeys collected together happily, gazing at Hanuman.They were wonderstruck to see Hanuman in that huge form, just as all beings were when they saw Lord Narayana in his incarnation of Vamana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkeys praised the mighty Hanuman as he grew in size whirling his tail around joyfully.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: As Hanuman was being praised by the monkey leaders, his body filled with lustre. It looked excellent.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Just as a lion grown in a mountain cave stretches its body, the Windgod's son stretched  (his limbs) at that time.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: On expansion, wise Hanuman's face was bright, glowing like a burning oven and  shining like smokeless fire.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Hanuman risen from the midst of the monkeys with his hair bristling on the body (due to expansion of body), saluted reverentially to the elderly monkey Jambavan and said :
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The Windgod is a friend of fire who is a powerful consumer of oblations. His strength is immeasurable. He wanders in the sky and shatters the mountain tops.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am the lawfulson of the swiftmoving Windgod, Maruta, comparable to him in leaping.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I can with all enthusiasm go round the vast mount Meru a thousand times without resting on it which is as though scratching the sky.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I can submerge this world including its mountains rivers and lakes. I can push back the sea waters quickly with my arms.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Thrust by my thighs,the ocean will rise up, carrying with it the shanks and  mighty crocodiles stunned by the force.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am capable of circumambulating a thousand times the great Garuda who consumes snakes and flies in the sky, the abode of birds.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O bull among monkeys when the Sun rises from behind the eastern mountain it is possible for me to start with him and go to the western horizon and return before the blazing Sun with its beams of light sets. It is also possible for me to descend to  the earth with the same speed and return to the Sun without touching the earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O bull among monkeys when the Sun rises from behind the eastern mountain it is possible for me to start with him and go to the western horizon and return before the blazing Sun with its beams of light sets. It is also possible for me to descend to  the earth with the same speed and return to the Sun without touching the earth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'If I rise up, I can overtake all those creatures flying in the sky and from there I can stir up the ocean and tear up the earth easily.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys when I leap, I can crush the mountains into powder and pull the vast ocean with me with the force of my thighs.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: And then as I leap through the sky flowers of many kinds of creepers and trees will follow me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkey when I fly upward in the dreadful sky or descend down, all creatures will see me, for my path will be the path of the constellation of Swati (a group of stars).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys when I fly in the sky like the great mount Meru, you will see me as if I am swallowing the sky because I will be enveloping it with my strides.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Only Garuda and Maruta have the capacity to fly like me. No one other than the king of vultures and the Windgod have the speed to fly like me.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'Just as the lightning generated by the clouds lands at once flying in the sky without any support I can also land in less than a moment.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O monkeys I have a feeling in my mind that I will see Vaidehi. Be happy.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I am equal to Maruta and Garuda in speed. I feel I can cover ten thousand yojanas (at a stretch).
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I think I can encounter Indra, wielder of the thunderbolt and obtain nectar from his hands. I can even confront Brahma, the selfborn creator courageously. I can even uproot Lanka and carry it.'
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The monkeys looked at him and were amazed, happy to see him roaring and shining in brilliance.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Jambavan, the finest of the monkeys, felt very glad on hearing his words which put an end to the sorrow of the kith and kin and said:
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O son of Kesari O son of Maruta O hero you have removed the great grief of your race, dear
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'By the blessings of the sages and by the grace of the elderly monkeys may you cross over the vast ocean.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Then the tiger among monkeys, Hanuman said to those forestdwellers (monkeys), 'The earth cannot bear the thrust of my leaping.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'The rocks on the peaks of the ranges of mount Mahendra cannot with stand it, although they are huge and firm.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'I will pick up speed on the peaks of mount Mahendra filled with different kinds of trees and minerals.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: 'O great monkeys these mountain peaks can withstand the crushing force of my feet as I leap over a hundred yojanas.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The son of Maruta, who was as eminent as the Windgod, the crusher of enemies ascended the great mountain Mahendra, full of grassland inhabited by deer, thickly grown with various trees and creepers full of fragrant flowers and fruits, where roam lions and tigers and proud elephants, a place that echoes with sounds of intoxicated birds and waterfalls.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The mighty, preeminent monkey who was equal to Indra in valour took a leap from the high peaks of the tall mountain, Mahendra৷৷
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Crushed by the feet of the great self, Hanuman, the huge mountain looked like a proud elephant struck by a lion.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The rocks of the mountain got scattered by the force. The deer and elephants were terrified. The trees were shaken up violently and streams of water gushed forth.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Shaken by the rude shock, couples of intoxicated gandharvas left in a huff the vast slopes of the great mountain. Flocks of birds and groups of vidyadharas flew away. The serpents went into hiding. Rocks fell off the shaken mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The serpents with their bodies half protruded out of the rocks and hissing looked like flags planted on the mountain.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: The alarmed and agitated sages abandonned the mountain peaks.The mountain appeared like a lone traveller separated from the caravan in the great forest.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.

instruction: Determine if the following shloka belongs to the Valmiki Ramayana.
input: Magnanimous, wise and heroic Hanuman, destroyer of enemy warriors, fixed his attention on speed, betook himself mentally to Lanka (ere he reached it physically). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामाणये वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।। Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
output: true, this is from Kishkindha Kanda, Sarga 67 of Valmiki Ramayana.
